Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: paesan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto was the perfect location for our Roman holiday. Lovely accomodations and briskly efficient staff was the perfect home base for a week in Rome. Breakfast buffet was great, and roaming the streets for discovering both new and ancient Rome was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ysabel
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we stayed at during our European trip (Madrid, Barcelona, Venice, Austria and Paris) this was the one we loved the most. You wouldn't think it was a lovely hotel by just looking at the hotel's facade and the street which had graffiti on its buildings but you will be pleasantly surprised once you step inside. The room that my husband and I got was a bit cramped but it was well-maintained and nicely furnished. The bathroom was made of marble, spacious and well-maintained. Bathroom fixtures seemed new. Breakfast buffet had a wide selection. Hotel is walking distance to a square surrounded by restaurants. Central location. I highly recommend this hotel despite its expensive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: JAMBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are definitely small, but on our stay here last week we had two connecting rooms for our family for the price of one room at the Westin. The location is amazing for site seeing--although we wished the metro were closer. Nonetheless we walked everywhere happily. We found the staff to be very helpful and kind (special shout out to Enrico from Queens!). It was by far the best bathroom we had in 10 days in Italy and the bed was nice and firm. Our only complaint was that Saturday and Sunday nights were really loud. We were on the 1st floor and the foot traffic across the bridge from Trastevere was constant until 4am. The windows were good, but happy drunks were too loud for them! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: paratanytarsus
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for a long weekend, I can advise that the lower floor classic rooms can be noisy. However if on a higher floor eg 4 and with the windows closed we experienced no noise. The alternative is to pay an extra 30 euro's a night for a superior room that faces the inner courtyard or gardens.Apart from this, the Hotel is central to the main attractions being 20 to 30 mins walk away from the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, and Vatican. The Hotel was very clean, the breakfast suitable for most travellers and the staff friendly. Although 4 of us we never had a problem getting seated at breakfast, and the bar was normally quiet. One of the bar staff who had apparently been employed for several years, did not know what a cafe latte was, and her margarita's were a little shaky. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel if I return to Rome. The Trastevere area is just over the bridge, an area full of restaurants and bars and very lively at night. Do not be put off by low prices at some restaurants as the food appears universally good. Beware of small buses that worm their way through the narrow streets and can be 6 inches from your elbow if dining outside

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Becky T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ponte Sisto for 3 nights during an Italy trip for our honeymoon. Our room was beautiful - king size bed, large tub/shower. There is an elevator - after a small set of stairs from the lobby but the porter will take your bags to your room. There is a lovely courtyard/patio with tables and chairs and umbrellas. The breakfast was beyond expectations. The orange juice was amazing. There was an assortment of breads, meat and cheeses, jams/jellies, scrambled eggs and bacon, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee/tea and an assortment of fresh juices. It really was quite a substantial spread. Cappuccino and expresso were available on request. The location was superb. Quick walk across the pedestrian bridge and you were in the heart of the Trastevere area with lots of character, restaurants and lively night spots. Walking the other way from the hotel you are in the Piazza Navona in 10 minutes. There's a small grocery store about a block away. Location is close to several bus routes also - including one that will drop you right at the entrance to the Vatican museums. Front desk staff was helpful and very nice. Overall this was a great hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: sagatourist
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights while sightseeing in Rome. Good location for walking to Forum, Colosseum, Vatican. Good room (superior) but bed was very firm. Breakfast was very good but, as the restaurant was closed for dinner, we strolled over the Tiber into the Trastevere area where there were plenty of places to eat. The staff were all friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PicasoOdessa
Reviews.Content: We had a big surprise when we arrived at this hotel. I will start by saying that it has an excellent location. We were able to walk to all Roman attractions (museums, pantheon, Piazza Navona, St.Peters etc.) We were across the Ponte Sisto bridge that leads to Trastevere that provided a big selection of places to dine and wine. Full buffet breakfast that included eggs, cheeses, pastries different types of bread, prosciutto bacon etc.with a lovely crew willing to accomodate your breakfast request. We can not complete this review without giving special thanks to two excellent front desk personnel, they were Mauricio and Marcelo. Mauricio went above and beyond his call of duty to ascertain that our stay was a memorable one. In our next visit to Rome we will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwags07040 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel, very well-located across the Tiber from Trastevere. My room (#302) which looked out on the courtyard was very quiet. During the warmer months, this room might catch some noise from the outdoor diners. The room size was quite adequate as I was traveling alone - some might find it a tight squeeze for two. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The breakfasts were ample and the wait-staff was also quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: Mrsvanm
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel, but I just didn't. My family loves to travel and I don't think that we have unreasonable expectations. We have stayed in quite a few other 4 star, smaller-sized hotels that really shined. Pros: clean room with up-to-date bathroom; quiet; good location; nice breakfast. Cons: room the size of a closet with the smallest window I've ever seen in a hotel room; front desk was abrupt and even dismissive (directions to dinner were "take a left down the street and it's under a tree"); only air came from a courtyard where people went to smoke. That pretty much killed it for me. We'll try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutorAfrica
Reviews.Content: I lived in Rome for five years and know the city well. Now when I travel there for work I generally stay at the Hotel Ponte Sisto. The location is the best in the city in my opinion. It's right across the Tiber from Trastevere -- my old neighborhood -- and it's a stone's throw from Campo de Fiori. You can walk everywhere from here or never even leave the neighborhood. The location is that good. Like lots of Italian hotels, the rooms are fine, not great but adequate. The staff is decent and kind. This is not a five star hotel, just a good, clean place to stay while you explore my favorite city on the planet. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: twinkletod
Reviews.Content: We had trouble choosing from all the hotels in Rome but plumped for this as it's in a great location. I was very glad when I arrived as it was pretty stylish and calm, a great haven from the buzz outside. The bed was fab, the staff chic, the bathroom gorgeous green marble and the room was very quiet. Easy to get to the Vatican, major shopping and restaurant areas, also Jewish quarter and across the river. The flower market in the square nearby was great. Transport links were great, buses were easy to use. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: chrismwm
Reviews.Content: When I booked I selected this hotel for location, cleanliness, and a full sized bathtub. Ponte Sisto delivered! Staff was helpful and knowledgeable. We borrowed a converter for our electronics, and got ice every night from the bar. Close to major sights, but chosen for closeness to both sites and restaurants in Trastevere. The bed was hard, but we were so tired from walking all day and enjoying a bottle of wine at dinner we crashed as soon as we laid down. It was warm for us as we're from the northern USA, but we were able to crack a window and be comfortable. Will stay again if ever in Rome as 175 dollars a night felt like a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel needs new decor.”
Reviews.Author: AAEN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto because of its location, almost everything is walking distance including Vatican, Colliseum, Trastevere and the various piazzas. 3 of us traveling together, room overlooked the lovely courtyard. The single bed appeared to be a 'cot' and nothing more. The room was very crowded. The marble bathroom was nice. Breakfast buffet while plentiful tasted like cafeteria food. Front desk staff seemed rude and not helpful. Seemed annoyed when a question was asked of them. Entire hotel needs a decorating update. The lobby and breakfast area look like a hospital.

Reviews.Title: “People not very plesant”
Reviews.Author: AlbertusMaximus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated between the Campo de Fiori and Trastevere, breakfast was good, however, all of this was erased by the attitude of the front desk personnel and manager. I stayed a the hotel, in a suite, and my daughter and son-in-law in a deluxe room. It was in the middle of May, and Rome was unusually hot for the period of time. Our rooms were sweltering!!!! I called the management, and was told that the air conditioning wasn't turned on in the building. I said it is really hot. No matter, they didn't turn on the main air conditioner. Needless to say, our stay wasn't very pleasant. Their advertisment on their web site said "air-conditioned rooms. Not air conditioned when we decide to turn it on." The became really ugly when I kept asking to have it turned on. Never did get the thing turned on, and our trip was over. Never again. Make sure you check the air conditioning at any hotel before you settle down into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good-could be great.”
Reviews.Author: Holmquist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the beginning of December. It was our anniversary and they marked the occasion by sending up a bottle of Prosecco. The entrance to the hotel is unremarkable, in fact the lobby and reception area could probably do with a freshen-up. Our room however, was lovely. High ceilings, plenty of space, and a great marble bathroom. We looked out over the courtyard which is recommended because it is nice and quiet both at night and in the morning. Location is excellent. Adjacent to the Campo Fiore, the Ghetto, and the Trastevere, all remarkably atmospheric parts of Rome. There is an excellent trattoria around the corner which the hotel recommended, called La Quercia. Great food and atmosphere and very reasonable. So good we went back a second night. Try the pistachio creme brulee! So, a reasonably-priced, brilliantly located, clean hotel with spacious rooms, with generally pleasant staff. Any downside? Nobody said 'you are welcome' when we checked in. One of the young women serving in the breakfast room was sultry bordering on rude. No fresh juice available with an otherwise very good breakfast. Little things like these keep a good hotel from being a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Menashebarnea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the heart of Rome near every thing and all the very interesting spots of Rome are easily reached. Very clean . Staff very polite and very professional. Very good breakfast. rooms are nice clean and well maintained not too big not too small . Comfortable bed.Highly recommended hotel .

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean reviews, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AussiePen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all that we could ask for in Rome - good location - within walking distance of the Travestere area and Campo dei Fiori, a good sized room that was clean and of reasonable size, and the breakfast was fine. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Angela F
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for seven nights. We're a family of five and booked the family junior suite which was perfect. We had a separate bedroom, with two additional rooms for our three kids. The location is perfect, with many in walking distance. We did take a cab a few times, but that was our choice. The breakfast was always fully stocked with a nice selection of food. We also enjoyed the bar in the early evening for a drink. We just wished that they has a full service restaurant with room service. Our rooms were very clean and the staff was great, especially Enrico. The hotel also arranged a private tour guide, Isabella, for us for two days. This was well worth it and I highly recomment it. We would stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: WisDC
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was very comfortable and clean. The hotel itself is nice with a pleasant courtyard when the weather is nice. Everyone raves about the breakfast, and it was better than we had at our other hotels in Italy, but nothing too special. The staff was mostly helpful, but seemed a little bored. The location is great though. Not a bad walk to most of the main attractions and right next to the river. I would definitely stay here again if we are ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best location we have had in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: barney42
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at the Ponte Sisto, gives you access to both sides of the river. We walked every where & enjoyed the neighborhood as well. Lovely staff. Thank you Donatella, the "best bartender in all of Rome". Our room was lovely as well. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Canada_Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour in October. We were a group of 3 in our tour. We were booked into a descent-sized room. The main room had 2 single beds, and the smaller room had a single pull-out bed. I'm sad to say that our first impression of the hotel was not a great one. We found a toenail clipping in one of the beds. We politely asked the front desk to change the bed. The woman who came to change the bed was quite rude and rolled her eyes at us. It's not like we were asking too much, as who wants to sleep in a dirty bed?! Front desk apologized for the dirty bed, but no one ever seemed that genuine. It was nice that there were slippers in the hotel room for guest use. The breakfast was nice, and they had a good selection of breakfast foods - hot foods, fruits, cheeses, meats, pastries, juices, etc. Location was within walking distance to the Jewish section, the teatro di Marcello, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, and the Pantheon. We also walked back from the Vatican, although it took us a while (it probably would have been better to take a bus back from the Vatican). There is a bus stop on the street to the right of the hotel if you are coming out the front doors. Locals were really nice and helped us figure out what stop to get off at. Although there are some good points to this hotel, we would stay at another hotel the next time we were in Rome because we were left with a bad impression of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Central Location”
Reviews.Author: corletoRG
Reviews.Content: One could not find a more central location as all major attractions are less than a mile walk. The Hotel is ideal for shoppers as there is a shopping district two blocks away. Trastevere is a short walk as well. The Hotel is near Campo Fiori Piazza for those that like to interact with the activiites at this busy Piazza. There are many excellent restaurants nearby. The staff is friendly and most helpful. The Hotel features a relaxing internal patio. Definitely on our "return" list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TerraFirmaCanada
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto is located - as the name suggests - very close to the north end of the bridge. Great nightlife (adults and families) just down the riverside stairs on the banks of the Tiber. There are many restaurants in the area, particularly along the narrow streets just across the bridge. For us (and well I'm over 50), it is in walking distance of most of the "must see" venues, such as the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Castel Sant'Angelo and St. Peter's. We also walked to the Forum, Victor Emmanuel Memorial and the Coliseum, though they were longer hikes. Close to bus routes in any case. We (three people) had a small suite, with doors closing between the very clean rooms for privacy. Internet (good) was included in the room price, as was a very good full breakfast buffet, served in a beautiful inner courtyard - a great experience in itself. We were there during an exceptionally hot spell and the air conditioning work very well. Heavy double-glass windows ensured quiet. Good staff service. Nice quiet bar downstairs, with lots of cold Peroni. What more could you want? Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: Gretel101
Reviews.Content: Over all, this is a solid 4 star hotel. I would recommend it and stay there again. Very comfortable and clean. Breakfast area is lovely and includes hot selections. Although the location is close to many major sights, you still need to plan time for getting there even if walking. Hotel was helpful for getting taxi's, but traffic slows them down.

Reviews.Title: “Always Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: jsheffie1946
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Ponte Sisto was October 13-14, 2011 and it was just as nice as we remembered it being the first time. Friendly staff, clean rooms and withing walking distance to almost everything to see and in Rome. We are looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Quite quiet in the middle of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jss525
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better. Trastevere and Campo dei Fiori few steps away, other attractions also in walking distance. The rooms were big enough, clean and surprisingly quiet. The staff was a bit "formal" but nice and very helpful. Only thing that could be better was breakfast. It was okay, but where were all the vegetables?

Reviews.Title: “Bland and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gypsyjaney
Reviews.Content: Although set in a good location near the ponte sisto bridge, the approach to this hotel is down a little alley which is rather grotty even by Italian standards, down to the graffitti over the front of the hotel itself. Good things - well located for the old part of Rome such as Piazza Navona and Campo dei Fiori; Helpful, cheerful porter (Mohommed) Our Room was a reasonable size and clean and comfortable; The hotel has an attractive central courtyard where a good buffet breakfast is served. Disappointing things - off putting approach to the hotel; desk staff polite and correct, but clearly suffering tourist fatigue; lack of ambience - not a hotel for those looking for much charm or personality (the courtyard is its best feature) more of a bland, business/coach tour type of place. Rooms and bathrooms, though very clean, are now looking rather dated and need upgrading; Information in rooms is inadequate - it was only on leaving that I discovered in the brochure that the hotel has a roof terrace - not mentioned anywhere else, but I didn't have time to find it; Rooms overlooking the courtyard can suffer from early morning noise when breakfast starts. I had been led to believe from other reviews (but not from the hotel itself) that rooms all had balconies, but this is not the case - in fact, I couldn't see any at all. All in all, not value for money - It certainly wasn't worth the almost 300 EU per night that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: pjm_pt
Reviews.Content: The rooms have all the ammenities you would expet from a 4 star hotel. No wireless, but you can ask for a cable at the reception, and then you get a fast internet connection. The rooms are well lit, but a bit noisy, as you can hear what's happening in the streets outside. Breakfast room is normally very crowded, and you would expect a wider selection to be available. Great location within walking distance of major monuments in Rome, including the Vatican. And it is the location that probably drives the prices up. Good comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Baileja
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews have already stated, this hotel is in a perfect location in Rome. My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in late September 2011 for 3 nights. We are both in our mid 30's and we managed to walk to all the main tourist spots from the hotel. The Coliseum (about 25min walk), Vatican (20min walk) and Piazza Novona and The Pantheon (about 15min walk) are all close by and we enjoyed walking rather than catching the many 'hop on hop off' bus tours that go around the city. Piazza Farnese and Campo de Fiori are also only a 5min walk away and are a great place to stop for a drink and bite to eat after a long day sightseeing. The hotel is very close to the Trastevere area, which where we went each night for dinner. A great area with a range of bars and restaurants to choose from. I would highly recommend you visit this area on your stay. The hotel itself is very clean and tidy. The breakfast buffet was good, although we did find that it was a little understaffed considering the number of tables to be waited on and there were some delays in replenishing the buffet. My tip would be to ask for a room that looks over the courtyard. Our room faced onto the alleyway and it was quite loud up to the early hours of the morning. The noise just seems to echo in the small alleys! However, the rooms that look over the courtyard should avoid this noise completely. The room was clean, large enough for us and the bathroom was also neat and tidy (although we did have a leaking shower that left alot of water on the floor!). I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel because of its location and reasonable price. I also note that from our stay the vast majority of guests at the hotel would also be 50+ in age.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: OpAPI
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff always went the extra mile. Printing documents off a USB stick? No problem. Finding a recommended ice cream store that was not listed on the internet or maps? No problem (they called around and hunted it down). Location is simply unbeatable. Clean, comfortable. Great hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: thornhillwillis
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights at this great hotel. Don't let the approach turn you off as you enter through a graffiti laden alley, but once inside, it's modern, spotless and inviting. I didn't find the front desk very pleasant, but that was incidental as everyone else was extremely pleasant including the chambermaid. Our very comfortable room overlooked the inner courtyard and although breakfast started very early, we weren't disturbed by any noise. The bathroom was very spacious and well appointed and after walking for hours, was an oasis to freshen up. The location was great, very close to Campo de Fiori and most other must see sites as well as the hop on hop off bus. There is a gelateria across the street that I would highly recommend. I had a fig and walnut cone that was the best gelato I had in Rome. I would definately recommend a stay at the Ponte Sisto.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl214
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto for two nights. The location was convenient to all of the major sights. The staff was welcoming and accomodating when we had questions. The breakfast was nice and best of all the hotel was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PortlandQuay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this very nice hotel for 4 nights, had a great time. Rooms are quite small, but adequate. Breakfast in the court yard is a lovely experience, but the best thing about this hotel is it's location. It's an easy walk to almost all of Rome's major attractions and the Piazza D Campo, is only just around the corner and a great place for lunch and dinner. Our only complaints - no english language TV stations, and no wifi in the rooms. The comments about the staff not being very friendly are true, but who cares, we were'nt in Rome to make friends with the staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bamaphan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 29th for 3 nights in our 1st city that we visited in Italy. Nothing but positive things to say about this property. As most reviews state you wonder about the location when you are dropped off in what 1st looks like an alley. But when you get your bearings you realize it is in an excellent location. Just across the bridge from Trastevere where all the locals hang out, eat and drink. Many good restaraunts in this area and the prices are much better than the main tourist areas. Excellent service and our room was good size with a huge bathroom. About a 10 minute walk to the Coleseium/Forum area and The Vatican is within walking distance also. The breakfast is outstanding.....by far the best we had in the three cities we stayed in. Lots of hot/cold choices, great scrambled eggs. Courtyard is very nice.....where breakfast is served. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sisto is the place for convenience”
Reviews.Author: Dixiedoughnut
Reviews.Content: What a clean clean hotel!!!! Very important when traveling abroad! The front desk staff were so very nice and helpful and our laundry was done very quickly and put back in our room in a very timely fashion. Our bed was cleaned each day with fresh towels, also very important when you have been walking around the city all day. The breakfast was very nice with many different items from which to choose. The location cannot be beat, easy to walk everywhere in Rome and we felt very safe walking the streets at night. The staff gave good recommendations for restaurants that were not tourist restaurants. Will be staying there again. Would highly recommend softer pillows and eggs cooked fried or poached would be a nice chance from scrambled.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel for a vacation in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir P
Reviews.Content: Very good location just in the middle of two historical districts: "campo dei fiori" and "trastevere". The rooms are bigger than usually in Rome. Very nice breakfast. Absolutely nice patio. Bar OK. Slightly overpriced and the staff can do more.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of Charm & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sylviastravels
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto was the Best Hotel we stayed in during our Visit to Italy in May 2011. The room for 3 was a little small but the huge patio/balcony really made up for the lack of space inside the room. We had some of our meals on the patio/balcony and enjoyed listening to the sounds of the neighborhood. The breakfast buffet every morning had a good variety of delicious food and was served in their beautiful courtyard. The oldest foot bridge in Rome is just a few minutes down the street and the Trastavere neighborhood is about a 10 minute walk away. The surrounding neighborhood is full of character, leather shops, a fabulous Gelateria , a wonderful church, a small market and so much more. I traveled with my husband and sister and we all agreed this was by far the best Hotel out of 3 hotels. If there are 3 in your party you can share a room but I highly recommend calling in advance let them know you need a room set up for 3. This is how we were able to get the room with the outdoor patio/balcony. Also ask for a room off the beautiful courtyard a room off the street can get a little noisy but once you closed the windows all was quiet and peaceful

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, brilliant location, brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annonymous186338
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the ponte sisto for three nights as me and my girlfriend were visiting friends who also happened to be in Rome. From the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out I couldn't come up with a complaint even if I tried my hardest. On the first day I received a map from the front desk with all the best tourist locations and a location where we could find food without loads of tourists. A couple of nights we came home late both times there was a staff member who let us in politely. Breakfast was amazing in the courtyard. Room was exactly as stated it would be. Never had a problem with the room being cleaned it was always done immaculately. My friends stayed at the Raphael which was nice no question but the service was not as good at the reception as the ponte sisto. I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Rome and a big reason for my enjoyment was the due to the great staff of the ponte sisto. Forgot to mention I checked in early no questions although it is so busy this may not always be possible.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny-Lee H
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, location was perfect. The hotel staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were great and the courtyard quaint. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Would definitely stay there again in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MobileGeek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip and i was so pleased. I was able to get to my business meeting easily from the location but i was also able to make good use of small segments of time to explore the old city on foot. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, including the porter who helped me with my bags. The breakfast is excellent value and the setting in the open courtyard is to be experienced. Rooms are small as you would expect in Rome, but well serviced and comfortable. I had a second floor room facing the back with a pleasant view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sbc789
Reviews.Content: We really loved the location of this hotel. It was close enough to walk to everything in the city including the Vatican, Trastevere, the Forum, Colusseum, Spanish Steps, the river yet located on a quiet side street near the very inviting Campo de Fiori. While our room was a bit small, it was very clean, had a delightful view of the charming courtyard, nice (tho' small) bathroom. Breakfasts in the courtyard were delightful. Big enough to be a full service hotel yet smallish too. No wifi in the rooms, but free wifi in the courtyard and lobby. Seemed like a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: montrealjw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a weekend getaway with my 16 year old niece. The hotel is in a great location - walk over the Ponte Sisto bridge and you are in the heart of Trastevere's restaurant area or walk to Campo Fiori, only a few streets away for the market and many other little pizzerias, cafes. Piazza Navona and even the main shopping street Corsi is in walking distance (although quite a bit further away). The staff are helpful, the centre courtyard is a nice little oasis, complete with palm trees and lots of nice plants. The breakfast is buffet style served in the courtyard and offers a good choice of pastries, breads, cheese/cold meats, fruit, yogourt as well as scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages. The room we had was on the 2nd floor facing into the courtyard which was good because it was very quiet, no street noise at night. The room size is standard for Europe, but the bathroom was very nice, all marble and quite spacious. Free internet is also offered. Overall, would definitely return for next trip to Rome. If you are taking a taxi from the main train station, make sure you don't get ripped off (don't go for the flat rate, meter will be better price since its not that far).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: adammfreed
Reviews.Content: The location is the best reason to stay at this otherwise bland hotel. Staff is very helpful (as should be expected at a 4 star hotel) and the courtyard breakfast is a bonus. Stay here for basic comforts without much charm and ability to explore some of rome's best neighborhoods

Reviews.Title: “location ,comfort,tranquility”
Reviews.Author: cny23
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited Rome and the stay at this hotel could not have been better. You are able to reach most every important site,the coliseum, the forum, spanish steps,etc, on foot. Restaurants are plenty with the Trastevere just across the bridge. I would highly recommend a seafood eatery called Pierluige, a five minute walk from the hotel. Expensive yes, but worth every penny. The hotel staff was not only friendly but professional and eager to assist. There is a unique garden area for breakfast that is tranquil and beautiful with a nice selection of pastry, fruits, cereals, and hot food. Our room was quiet and very clean with a good size bathroom to boot. We will absolutely return to this hotel when we return to Rome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: hjms55711
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our two teenage boys and had rooms 226 and 227. It's one door with a private hallway leading to two doors (two rooms). The service was excellent, the rooms were small but clean and nice. The bathrooms were big and VERY nice. The location is great and the buffet breakfast each morning in the courtyard is WONDERFUL!! We loved it and would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lor1st52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally in Rome for the most popular sites. We walked to almost all the most famous sites from the hotel. The colorful neighborhood Trasteve is just a 5 minute walk. It's a great neighborhood to hang out in at night. The breakfast has a wide variety of choices. The staff is very helpful. There's a great little traditional coffee shop across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bas077
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by the small frontage as it opens up like an Aladdins cave inside. We had a very nice room on the 4th floor overlooking the inner courtyard where an excellent buffet breakfast was available. Room was air conditioned and very quiet with a firm but very comfortable bed. A beautiful large bathroom was very well appointed All major attractions are in walking distance and there are dozens of restaurants all around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rebajane22
Reviews.Content: Great location, we were able to walk just about everywhere and just across the bridge from Trastevere. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were given two excellent restaurant recommendations for dinner by front desk staff. Excellent breakfast buffet. It was a very hot July and the air conditioner kept the room temperature comfortable. Would go again in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Georgiakk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute after an apartment booking fell through and now we are so glad it did. The rooms were small by our (Australian) standards but on par for Rome. The breakfast courtyard is absolutely gorgeous and the breakfast itself was great - eggs / bacon / sausages as well as huge selection of meat / cheese / fruit / pastries. Loved the location, walk out of the hotel and stroll across the Ponte Sisto to Trastevere, the restaurant district. Walking distance to all the main sites, including the Vatican. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for mother and daughter”
Reviews.Author: madreandsass
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto for our first trip to Rome. The hotel was nicely decorated and clean. The staff at the reception desk was helpful. The rooms were satisfactory for our stay of three nights. The best feature of the hotel for us was the courtyard with great breakfast. On our first evening in Rome we walked to the Spanish Steps to join in a walking tour. The walk there took about 40 minutes but was easy and took us through several points of interest. The hotel was within easy walking distance of Travestere, Piazza Navona, and Campo de Fiori. It was disappointing at first not to be near a metro stop but we were able to work around that. The wifi was only available to us in the lobby and we did not find that reliable---that was the only disappointing inconvenience. There was a small market just a few doors away and that came in handy one evening.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again, and again, and again...maybe forever!”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: The most fabulous location possible! Half a block from the pedestrian bridge over the Tiber River to Trastevere. Very close to Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. Easy walk to Vatican and Castle St. Angelo. Hotel was charming with a beautiful interior courtyard. Clean rooms were nicely furnished and had modern bathrooms. The most comfortable bed, linens, pillows! Plenty of closet space and a large desk area. The room was not huge, but I did not feel cramped for space at all. Lovely view from the window. Free Internet. The buffet breakfast was fabulous...plenty of variety, everything fresh and delicious. Professional staff was accommodating. Located on a pedestrian-only street. No traffic noise. My first choice in Rome (and I have stayed in at least 15 other hotels in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Friends and Family”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCAB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ponte Sisto was the perfect spot for our group of 4 adults and 3 children ages 10 13 & 15. We had ajoing rooms and a wonderful patio off our rooms. We walked to all the major Roman sites, including the Vatican, Fourm, Spanish Steps etc. The staff was wonderful and the buffet breakfast was a great way to start the day. Thanks we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LKStrange
Reviews.Content: I probably looked at 150 hotels on different sites for a two night post cruise stay. We were thrilled with our choice. Were able to walk to all the sites on our list of must sees. The hotel was immaculate, and felt very European. Located off a main street on a quiet alley way. Just a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Neevie
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a great location to walk to many of the Rome attractions. Hotel was very clean and accommodating with comfortable rooms and beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair access and review”
Reviews.Author: mishahu
Reviews.Content: Our room had good wheelchair access with roll-in shower and handrails. See photos. There is a small step at the main entrance but the doorman brings a portable ramp. The room is large and comfortable. Breakfast is generous and varied. Service at the hotel was efficient but not friendly. For the price of staying at this hotel, why is there no wi-fi and you have to pay not only to access the internet from the two public computers but even to use them at all? It is in a good location close to Campo Fiori and not far from Piazza Navona and in the other direction to the river and the interesting area of Trastevere. It is in walking/rolling distance to many of the tourist sites. However for the wheelchair user streets and piazzas in the old areas of Rome is not easy due to spaces between large cobble stones that trap castor wheels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Speak English, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: susanissnoozin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ponte Sisto is located within walking distance of the Colosseum and Vatican City, It is just across a pedestrian bridge that crosses the Tiber River into the Trastevere section of Rome that has lots of great restaurants! They have a great breakfast buffet which is often served out in an open courtyard with giant palm trees! My family of three rented a triple room . Unfortunately, I went through a travel agency and didn't understand that our room overlooked a busy street. It was like being back in college again, with people laughing and singing as they strolled by our window until all hours of the night. If we went there again, I would rent a room that faced the courtyard or opposite side of the hotel. The interior was clean and thoughtfully decorated. The desk staff all spoke very good English, which was good for us (only knowing a few Italian words!). Beds were comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Nick062
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this hotel in early May. The room (a superior double) was very nice, overlooking the courtyard. The staff was very helpful in providing recommendations for restaurants, etc. Does not have wireless in rooms, but does have it in the lobby as well as a computer you can use downstairs (for a small fee). Breakfast was very good. The location is wonderful, with most of the major sites within walking distance. I would give it 5 stars but the price seemed a little high ($304 Euros/night)

Reviews.Title: “The Ponte Sisto saved our camera!”
Reviews.Author: Joey-Luly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto is in an absolutely great location near Trastevere, the Campo di Fiori, and Pantheon. We loved the Trastevere area because it was not packed with tourists and had quaint restaurants and bars. It is also a great area if you want to go out late at night and have a few drinks. Still, the hotel was near other touristy locations if that is what you are into (which naturally we obviously visited). The rooms at the Ponte Sisto are clean, simple, and spacious (for European standards). The TV had a wide range of channels. The hotel had a nice little courtyard which we would have loved to have enjoyed, but unfortunately we visited Rome in its cold rainy season. The staff/service was a little cold when we arrived but boy did they prove us wrong. On our first night in Rome, we were lucky enough to have tickets to attend the Christmas Eve Papal Mass in the Vatican. The hotel called us a taxi and air-headed me left our camera in the cab. My husband and I were completely bummed, thinking we would never see our camera again. We told the hotel our misfortune and the very next day the hotel tracked the cab driver down and had our camera back in the hotel by noon. We could not believe it! The staff may not have a huge obvious smile stamped on their faces, but they sure came through when we needed them!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Example of an Overpriced, Forgettable Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vasio
Reviews.Content: There is nothing particularly wrong with this place. That said, it is grossly overpriced. The rooms are tired. The bedding is tired. The carpeting is tired. The staff is lackluster. The breakfast is fine, but, again for the price, not worth it. We stayed in April. And despite historically lower temperatures this time of year it was quite hot out. 85 degress. The hotel refused to turn on its AC to the rooms, claiming it is there policy to not do so before "summer time." This place isn't cheap and it was our worst night of sleeping all trip. When you pay this much for one night you expect to at least get ac. Thank god we only stayed 1 night. The part that really pissed me off was that the hotel reception area HAD ac, making it very hard to listen to their reasoning for why the guests shouldn't have the same perk. I'm not a negative reviewer, and usually find the best of every place I stay. But, this hotel is nothing special and dented our wallet pretty bad. My wife and I know how to stretch a dollar, and this place is not the hotel to do it. The location is fine near the Trastevere and the Campo di Fiori- the reason we chose the hotel. The area is safe and easy to get to. Honestly, the best thing we got from our stay was a lesson in Roman hotel rip-offs. We prefer the Hotel Smeraldo, no frills, but, very clean and in a better spot. It was booked our last night of the trip which is how we ended up here. I would NOT tell my friends or family to stay here unless everything else in town was booked. I would tell them to save their hard earned money and stay somewhere else. If money is not a concern, enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great in everything”
Reviews.Author: skiermontreal
Reviews.Content: great location at walking distance of all main attractions and of restaurants in Trastevere, clean hotel, great service, great breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Hotel Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: dqsmaine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, spacious and has a very knowledgable staff. We loved the location, we were able to walk to the Pantheon, Vatican City. We found some great restaurants across the Ponte Sisto bridge, Ferrara and Augusto. The street might get noisy on a week night.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING!!”
Reviews.Author: kathieann
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just spent 8 nights at the Hotel Ponte Sisito. It is located on a tiny syreet at the foot of the Ponte Sisto which leads you into Trastevere, a quaint old Italian cobblestone village filled with many Italian restaurants. The hotel is within a short walking distance to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and Campo de Fiore. It is also a 1/2 hr. leisurely walk to the Vatican. Our "superior" room was very disappointing. Even by European standards, it was very, very small. With the queen bed, s nightstand, and a desk, there wasn't much room to move around. Closet space was minimal with a safe a 3 small drawers. I've been on cruese ships where cabins were much larger! The bathroom was adequate but large enough for one person at a time. We did have a balcony which was adjacent to other balconies on our floor- not much privacy. When my husband asked if this was the room we requested, they were very rude. Our bed was the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept in. The mattress was extra, exra firm and sat on a bed board with no box springs. Even the pillows were extra hard. My husband who prefers firm mattresses even had trouble sleeping. My biggest complaint was the housekeeping, or lack thereof. There was clean linen and towels daily but the furniture was not dusted and the floor was not vacuumed. The bathroom ws another issue. There was just one glass in the room. With 2 people i the room, I guess we were meant to share. Also this glass was not replaced or cleaned in our 8 days stay. I did find 2 glasses in the mini bar which we used. The common areas were beautiful and clean and the daily buffet breakfast was delicious. However, if we asked for a second cup of cappuccino, we were told rudely that we would have to pay for it! It felt that odd since there were many other guests with large pots of regular and yea on their tables. I never felt welcome by the hotel staff they always gave us the feeling that visitors were a nuisance. My husband speaks Italian fluently and we have been to Italy many times and we were appaled by the treatment here. This is so unike th Italians. There was a lovely bar/lounge, but the few times we were there, the place was empty and we found it quite boring. All that being said, we would not stay here again, nor recommend it to others. BTW, there is a great restaurant called "Sergios" just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: allDeckedOut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome and want to thank the staff at the Ponte Sisto for their help. I fell ill while at the hotel and the man at the front desk was able to help my wife get the medication that I needed on a holiday were everthing was closed. The room they gave us (423) was HUGE!!! with a big bath tub (no shower though), sitting area, and a huge terrace. The room was new, clean (changed the bedding daily!!!) and bright. Breakfast was very good and the staff was fantastic. If I had to complain it was that the hotel is located on a street that connects with a bridge to a livley part of town. So becuase the government does not allow A/C to be turned on till June 1st I had to keep doors open for some air. The streets get loud at night and the sound carries up into the room. The hotel is so big, and there is a great court yard that I would ask for a room off the main street next time, BUT I would stay here again and again. BIG NOTE a must for dinner is Da Luiggi's. Try the Pasta Fagoli but beware of the hot oil.... Also see if you can find the secret hidden roof top garden....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, top location, good service -- it has it all!”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: This property is closer to a 5 star property than 4. Like the other reviews note, Hotel Ponte Sisto is ideally located. Walking distance to ALL major sites in downtown Rome. My room was spacious for European standards, very comfortable, and the amenities were tops. The bathroom was luxurious, as were the linens. The front desk staff were very helpful -- once you asked. For example, I could not read the small print on the tourist map of the city and asked for an easier to read map. The staff went to the photocopier and enlarged the sections of the map that I needed, and highlighted the key sites and walking routes. Phenomenal. I arrived early in the AM -- they let me in my room without hesitation. Many reviewers have already noted the excellent breakfast. Room temperature was easy to control. Truly, this facility has it all and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ArielaIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with a child, early check in was requested and we received the room upon arrival at 10AM. nice! The room was picked in accordance with our requests and not facing the street and the baby bed was already in the room. This was a double superior. Medium sized room but comfy, good sized bath, Strangely there were no shelves in the big closet, and no bathrobe or tea/coffee facilities in the room. The service was great, good speaking english staff and friendly especially Marcello and Luna. Please note that rooms not facing the street require some steps to reach the eleveator, which might be an issue with a stroller, Elevators are quite and spacious, The room was 100% silent and comfortable and zero noises from either the street or the hotel could be heard, Dark curtains provide complete darkness so we reallly slept well, Great Breakfast, coldcuts, cheese, assorted breads and pastry, fresh fruitm eggs bacon etc, guices, cereal and of good quality, Nice inner courtyard . The location is excellent, safe to walk at night, supermarket 10 min away, bars and restaurants, shops all within a minutes walk. Campo de fiori and Trastevers are so close its amazing. would stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, but a bit noisy at night...”
Reviews.Author: emnrich2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great staff and a very easy trip to all the sites. On a busy side street, which is good and bad, but great stay for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Happel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ponte Sisto was a great hotel in Rome. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. They were fairly small which is to expect in Rome but the bathroom was a nice size. The breakfast was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishRoverDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early February. Charming, small hotel, neatly tucked away, right down at the river. Great location for all the sights, very close to Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navonna, Pantheon etc. Trastevere area just over the bridge and you will get much better value eating there. Our room was smallish but fine - the beds very comfortable with crisp bed linen. Slept very well as there is no noise at all. The bathroom was a great size and very nice. The Breakfast buffet is very substantial. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cupecoy
Reviews.Content: Despite the GoogleEarth photos, this is a lovely, warm, and inviting hotel in an excellent location for exploring Rome. My husband and I are in our 40s and felt a little young for the establishment; most of the other guests appeared significantly older. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The linens were high quality and new. The staff was friendly enough and spoke English. The complementary breakfast buffet was amazing--rivaling anything I've seen in the US. The hotel is just around the corner from a small square which hold a large market during the day and wonderful patio restaurants at night. All in all, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: ukalum04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Rome.... within walking distance to all the major sites. The rooms are nice and the facility is very clean. Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice place to stay where they can walk to all the sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “If your room faces the street, don't expect to sleep at all.”
Reviews.Author: briccard0
Reviews.Content: We had four rooms and all faced the street. Exhausted from traveling, none of us slept at all. The street is a major thoroughfare and all night long we heard partying, screaming, fighting, singing, I could go on and on. So ask for a room facing the interior, because this is a very nice and clean hotel with a superior breakfast, delightful staff. We could not get any air movement with their air handling system either. The staff told us he had no other rooms available, but it was late November, so I can't say I believed him.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: C5Guy
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 night in a nice exterior room with a large marble bathroom. The weather was perfect so we slept with the windows open. We were on the alley side so noise was no problem. The breakfast was one of the best with eggs, bacon, sausage, cheese, prosciutto, fruit, yogurt, breads, etc. We walked to all the sites, except the Vatican. But we had to be there on time for a tour. Make sure you get a cab with a meter -- they will rip you off. We walked across the bridge to Trastevere each night for dinner. There are numerous restaurants -- we never ate at the same one twice. We saw just a few tourists despite the wonderful food and low prices. The hotel staff was great except for one bellman (with longish black hair) who rolled is eyes and groaned about any request. Other than that my only other complaint was the price of the hotel. Therefore I rate it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome, wish it wasn't so pricey”
Reviews.Author: Renee59
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue but I wanted to review this great hotel near Campo di Fiore. We stayed last July after having to reschedule our postponed trip from last year, and the Ponte Sisto was gracious enough to allow us to use our prepaid deposit after a last minute cancellation, so I did want to acknowledge that. Some of the hotels were not so accomodating. We booked a two room suite (actually two separate rooms that shared a private common hallway). This was perfect for our family of 4 since we had a lot of privacy yet could open the interior doors to the rooms, I think the room numbers were 508 and 509. Our room had a very small balcony (oddly entered from the bathroom) and a nice view, while our sons room just had a window. Both rooms were very comfortable, the A/C worked great (we were there during a heat wave) and we made good use of the very big "mini" fridge to keep drinks cool. Also the rooms were very quiet. We loved the location and walked to Trastevere for dinner...what a great spot. In fact, we walked everywhere in Rome from the Ponte Sisto, even the Vatican. The staff was very accomodating, my husband had a craving for Granita di Caffe one afternoon and couldn't find it, so when we returned to the hotel we asked the bartender if they made it. They didn't, but he went out of his way to make it from scratch and it was much appreciated. The breakfasts were the best we had anywhere, so many choices and great scrambled eggs and bacon. I like by scrambled eggs cooked really well and one morning they were barely cooked. I guess one of the waitresses noticed my disappointment when I looked at the eggs and asked if I needed anything. I told her I liked my eggs very well done and 3 minutes later she brought out a large dish cooked just the way I like them. Speaking of breakfast, the courtyard it's served in is gorgeous. The only reason I didn't give the Hotel Ponte Sisto 5 stars is because of the price - For the two rooms we paid aboutt $600 a night which was considerably more than the rate when we originally booked forAugust of 2009. It was more than I would normally spend but we had already prepaid our entire stay so had no choice. If the prices were more reasonable I would definitely rate the Hotel Ponte Sisto 5 stars. Great little hotel in a great location with great service, but I think there are better values in Rome. If you can get a good rate, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kearse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights over a three week period as we were taking trips around Tuscany and Umbria. The price is fair for the level of hotel it is. The hotel's decor is quite nice. The three different rooms we stayed in were very clean and had a nice modern feel. There is a small grocery store next door, which was nice to have. Unlike some other reviews, we found the neighborhood quiet so we slept well and the A/C worked fine (it only comes one when the windows are closed). The breakfast buffet is excellent compared to other Euopean hotels. Only two complaints: some (not all) of the male desk staff were not helpful for some reason. They seemed to be resentful if you asked for anything. The female desk staff were very helpful and the rest of the staff were quite good at their jobs. Also the hotel is not located near the Metro, but that could be because it is near the Tiber. Being near the Tiber was nice as that is a nice way to walk around the city. Overall, a pleasant experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitley come again”
Reviews.Author: AlonGaneyTikvaIsrael
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights with my daughter. The location was great, near Campo Di Fiori, Piazza Navona, and 10 minutes walk from many bus lines. The hotel is very clean and the room was comfortable. Excellent breakfast with good service. The stuff at the reception was very friendly and helpful above and beyond our expectations, especially Marcello. Lovely and relaxing patio with a nice Garden for relaxing from the hassle of Rome. We enjoyed our stay very much, we already recommended it to our friends and we intend to stay there next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelerllz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 10-13. Two women, long-time friends, traveling around Italy with last stop in Rome. As others have noted in reviews of hotel, the location is a bit off-putting at first, especially if first time in Rome. Cab or car can't really drive directly to front of it, although our car to airport did park directly in front. This was my 2nd time to Rome, and the last time stayed up near Vatican. Much preferred this location and the hotel - more central to everything. Location is just a walk to many terrific food options, including to Trastevere just across the bridge. Also close to ancient Rome (Colosseum, Roman Forum, ruins), as well as shopping. The interior courtyard is a very nice aspect of the hotel, and on several nights hotel guests were sitting out there with cocktails from the bar. We found the desk staff to be very helpful and accomodating - with restaurant recommendations, help finding an adapter for a hair straightener, reserving a car for airport, directions to different places, and even Enrico trying to help me with a wine shipping situation. Decent breakfast and good bar with wide choice of cocktails and wines. Nice rooms - small as typical for Europe - but very modern and aesthecally appealing plus clean. Adding down or other softer pillows would be a definite value-add. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: RamblinRabbits
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about our time in Rome at the Hotel Ponte Sisto. First off, the location was perfect, centrally located within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in Rome. Also, it's right across the street from the river and there's a small grocery store just a couple doors down. Buy your bottled water there and snacks too. It's so much less expensive and the water bottles are giant. If you need anything, the hotel staff are all very nice and helpful and they speak English. The breakfast was great too. Lots of variety. The rooms were very nice. We were pleasantly surprised. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to walk Ancient Rome, Campo De Fiori”
Reviews.Author: katensteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon. It was a cab ride from the Stazzio Termini but otherwise in good walking location from most of the sights, and literally around the corner from Campo De Fiori, our favorite plaza in Rome. Campo De Fiori has great restaurants, shopping, wine bars and atmosphere. The hotel itself was well furnished and the suites are huge w/ AC - perfect for a family as they have a separate room (with closing door) that can be transformed into a bedroom (couch turns into a bed.) Great bathroom with jacuzzi tub, but we had no view from our room. The staff weren't the friendliest and we mostly chose our own restaurants and sights using a guide book, but they are all so close by that you can't really go wrong. If everything hadn't been so easy/close, we may have been more frustrated with the staff. Overall it serves as a perfect launch pad for a visit to Rome, and the rooms are big, clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, spotless, and convenient to many of Rome's attractions”
Reviews.Author: PTMcGiffin
Reviews.Content: The Ponte Sisto is located a short distance from a bridge (for which the hotel is named) over the Tiber River. From the hotel, it is a short walk to Piazza Navona, Campo de’ Fiore (a cozier square with a public market and restaurants), and, over the bridge, Trastevere, an historic residential area known for its restaurants and cafes. Vatican City is a bit further away, perhaps a mile, but walkable (if you like walking). Ponte Sisto's street presence is unassuming, or, to the uninitiated (like us), almost alarming: it is about a block from the river, on a narrow road/alley liberally decorated with graffiti. A short time later we realized that this describes much of Rome (at least this part of it), and these streets are well-populated and safe. Once inside, one's first impressions are quickly revised; the lobby is small but welcoming, and overlooks a beautiful courtyard. The front desk staff speaks English, which was very assuring on our first trip to Europe. The rest of the staff responded warmly to our attempts to use some hastily-learned Italian, and felt quite welcome. Our room was not overly large, but provided all the essentials and then some. There was ample closet space for our unpacked luggage, a roomy marble bath, desk with wired internet service, and one of the most comfortable king-sized(?) hotel beds we have ever enjoyed, which was most welcome after a couple of days of long walking tours. (Unfortunately, we were experimenting with traveling with iPads in lieu of a laptop, and the wired internet service did not meet our bleeding-edge needs...) The hotel provides an excellent breakfast buffet in the courtyard every morning. The buffet offered a wide selection of hot and cold choices, including eggs, sausage, bacon, cereals, fruits, etc. The tables are set with linen napkins and tablecloths, and the wait staff was helpful and courteous (and tolerant of my clumsy Italian). Our least favorite experience was the temporary loss of the single elevator serving our end of the bulding, but we did learn a few things about the hotel traversing the four flights of stairs. The breakfasts were a high point of every day, but we were especially grateful for the services of Ricardo at the front desk: when we had trouble coordinating with the operator of a motor coach tour we were scheduled for, Ricardo responded to our questions by calling the tour operator and arranging for pickup at our front door. The Ponte Sisto was an ideal hotel for this pair of first-time visitors to Rome, and we would not hesitate to stay there again when we go back (hopefully soon).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hughm88
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good rooms and a beautiful courtyard that hosts their very nice breakfast each morning. The best location with the Ponte Sisto bridge on the corner you can walk through the cafe lined streets that curve through the neighborhood. Nice expresso at the small store front across the alleyway. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well situated”
Reviews.Author: CTRoberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto on a friend's recommendation. The hotel is located on a quiet lane a block from the Ponte Sisto and several blocks from the open air market, Campo de Fiori. Price of the room includes lovely full breakfast buffet (in the courtyard if weather permits.) We were able to walk everywhere in the city from this location and found the staff quite helpful with directions, reserving drivers, etc. The room was definitely on the small side, with a cute outdoor balcony (shared with other rooms)--a little pricey but not out of line with big city prices. Would definitely stay there again. Soundproofing was so-so, though the spot is quiet. Do not skip a slice of pizza at the Forno on Campo de Fiori! (We used Rick Steves's ROME everywhere we went and had a fabulous experience!)

Reviews.Title: “WOW. I want everyone I know to stay here”
Reviews.Author: GrandCO
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional in solving an electrical problem: they spent over an hour trying to get a heating pad to work. There was alway a cheerful greeting and each staff person was just generally helpful. The breakfast buffet was delicious, so many choices that we never tired of them even though we were there a week. The room was typically small, but serviceable. The bathroom was luxurious. Very large towels. Location was superb; we could walk to just about everything. It was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Ponte Sisto - Bad AC, Great Breakfast, Great Staff, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: JohnMattS
Reviews.Content: Well, I was there at the end of August 30-31 degrees celsius. Room AC only allowed +-3 degrees celsius. It was not very cold which was a huge disappointment after long, hot outings. Dont know if other hotels which offer AC are better.......but I would have gladly paid more to have it. No point in visiting Rome in July and August without AC. Maybe that way everywhere in Rome. Breakfast was a really, really good. Fruit, rolls, proscuitto, cereal, coffee, eggs, sausage etc. Front desk, restaurant, room service staff all superb.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique style hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: azphysician
Reviews.Content: I had a one day meeting in Rome which happenned to fall on our 37th wedding anniversary so my wife and I spent 5 days at the Ponte Sisto proir to the meeting and had a marvelous time. The staff could not have been more helpful- they even lent me a cable cord and the proper plug since I had brought a plug that apparently only worked in Germany. We got a room upgrade for no fee. The bed was large and comfortable, the view of the lovely courtyard was great and the bathroom was spacious with all the needed amentities. The breakfast was remarkable and by far the best free breakfast we have had at any hotel anywhere. I am still trying to figure out how they made such tasty eggs and bacon. The location could not have been better- right at the Ponte Sisto bridge over the Tiber and a 2 minute walk to Travestere which is the best place in Rome to spend an evening just wandering and enjoying the locals and eating at one of the many small cafes. There always sems to be entertainment in the church courtyard. As other have noted everything one wants to see is within walking distance. Finally the price was right- 750 euros for 5 nights all inclusive. .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: m0m0m
Reviews.Content: Rome is a rather walkable city so as long as you stay in central Rome location is not an issue. But this location is even more central. Coliseum/Forum, Vatican, Pantheon, are all within 20 minutes walk. Spanish Steps is a further walk but I prefer to stay away from that touristy area. Across a pedestrian bridge from Trastevere, great dinner choices. Rooms are small but well designed, bathrooms are beautiful and spacious. Buffet breakfast is outstanding, served in a nice garden. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pushing 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: wdarrah
Reviews.Content: This hotel way exceded my expectations. The staff was great. Even had a 110 outlet for US style plug in bathroom. It is as nice as the photos make it look and located in the historic center. Don't let the price fool you, this hotel is only missing a little marble or this hotel would be a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, wonderful way to start and end our trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatikids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto our first night in Rome and again 2 weeks later on our last night in Italy. Loved the charm of the hotel, staff very accomodating and friendly. Rooms very comfortable and well appointed. Breakfast was wonderful in the courtyard with many choices for adults and kids. Great nieghborhood for shopping and evening dinners. Really a charming find in Rome! (our teenage daughters loved it as well!) Would stay there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Chris & Julie Portland Victoria Australia”
Reviews.Author: jsamuel4
Reviews.Content: We booked this accomodation via the internet, it was our last night in Europe so we thought we would splash out on a top nights accomodation, the deluxe room that we booked was on arrival just a normal double room, we went back to reception to enquire about this and found the staff to be rude and not happy that we thought to question our rooms and when being shown alternative rooms found the valet to think he was far to good for his job. We eventually did get a better room but at greater cost. Be wary of photos of rooms on this place as all is not what it seems.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel; limited kinds of dining in the area though”
Reviews.Author: KahnJC
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful, the free breakfasts very enjoyable in the flowered courtyard, and our twin-bedded room (room 409) was attractive, adequate size, nice marble bathroom with tub/shower combo, and had a pretty view of the courtyard. The beds are the European hard kind, which we got used to. The only real complaint we had about the room was that the air conditioning setting is controlled from the main desk downstairs and even though they set it for 20 C when we complained of being hot, the room temperature never fell below 23.7, which was not quite cool enough to refresh us after heavy sightseeing in the summer heat. I had thought maybe the problem was being on the top floor, but the hallway outside our room was cool, and the downstairs lobby as well, so the problem seemed to be just our room. We wished for free Wifi. There is a DSL connection in the rooms for those who bring PCs, but we were using iPads and iPods and ended up buying a prepaid hour (5 Euro) card to use the one guest computer on the lower level. Rome doesn't seem to have a lot of free Wifi, but we did find one free hotspot outside the Vin Allegra wine bar in Traverstere, which, by the way, had a great 4 Euro glass of wine. The transportation links were pretty decent; taxis are very plentiful along the river road, and the number 23 bus goes right to the Vatican from the stop a block from the hotel. The 116 heads up towards the Spanish steps. Also, there are some cute shops on the street and it's an easy walk to ATMs, piazzas, bakeries, etc. The Ponte Sisto pedestrian bridge links the hotel to the Traverstere neighborhood, a lively cafe scene. We ended up going there a few evenings. But we got tired of the outdoor-cafe-dining-in-muggy-hot-weather routine, and there was a shortage of indoor, air conditioned restaurants in this historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jan052010
Reviews.Content: Having raved about the Hotel Ponte Sisto last August, we were disappointed with it this June. We stayed for four nights this time. First, we were shocked at the miniscule room and miniscule bathroom, for the same price that we paid last August. There was no room in the bathroom even to set a toiletry kit down! Breakfasts were not being served on the beautiful terrace, which didn't seem to be ready for guests. Instead breakfast was served in a small breakfast room, which, this time was populated by shouting, cackling tour groups. Bad enough to have to put ujp with them in the cathedrals, but at breakfast? It was horrible. One morning we had to wait 15 minutes just to find seats at a table. Not relaxing at all. The front desk staff were frosty though professional. We also found the hotel a little distant from many of the sights we wanted to visit on foot. I agree that this is now a 3* hotel masquerading as a 4*. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars masquerading as four”
Reviews.Author: sibeliusLondon
Reviews.Content: First the plus points: good location, delightful large outdoor courtyard for meals. Now the bad points: all other rooms without any charm or character, bad breakfasts with awful coffee unless you order something like a capuccino but you are only allowed one small cup within the breakfast rate and have to pay for any additions. No fresh juice but only very orange orange squash type stuff. Staff who regard visitors as a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: littlestlittle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for 5 nights and we had a great time. The hotel was wonderful. The free breakfast was great! The front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. The hotel is in a wonderful area, and is within walking distance to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Lindav16
Reviews.Content: Great hotel couldn't fault it, very helpful friendly staff, clean airy rooms, lovely bathrooms. The breakfast was set in a pretty courtyard with a varied menu from cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts to some cooked food. Ideal position for all of the monuments and places we wanted to visit. This hotel is a credit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kimkay
Reviews.Content: First visit to Rome,stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto and loved it. Location was excellent. Worked perfectly for providing rooms next to each other for teenagers. Market 3 shops down to pick up items that we forgot, or to grab soda or snack. Internet was free. Breakfast was included and outstanding. Would stay again and recomment to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: graciekatz
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay was perfect. The room was modern, clean, quiet and comfortable. In-room internet was free and worked great. Location is steps from the Ponte Sisto (bridge) to Trestavere, a neighborhood where people live, work and dine, and it is not just a tourist area. Narrow street is unusual by US standards but creates a quiet setting. Our room overlooked the courtyard with large windows that opened. A/C was provided as well for the warm May afternoons. Breakfast was wonderful. There was a great variety, and the ladies in the breakfast room were very nice, cheerful and helpful. The front desk staff speak English fluently which helped a lot since my Italian is at the beginner stage. They were always ready with a recommendation for restaurants and shops, but their real moment to shine was at 5 am on our day to leave when my suitcase zipper broke. They brought an extra sewing kit to our room and I sewed the suitcase shut. It made it home without spilling anything. Thank goodness airport security didn't need to inspect inside... We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little too pricey”
Reviews.Author: RBAinItaly
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for four nights. The location is terrific--it's so close to the actual bridge (the Ponte Sisto) that you always have a homing beacon. It's just a couple minute's walk to Campo di Fiori and the Piazza Navonna. We easily did all the main sights from this locale, and the adjacent neighborhood of Trestevere was cool. Our superior triple room (number 505) met our expectations but was not overly spacious. It had nice amenities and a nice private terrace. The bathroom was just as advertised on their Web site--all marble, sparkling clean, akin to what you would expect in a US hotel for business travelers. The tub itself was super. The beds were comfy. I wish the decor of the room had a little more pizzaz or charm--it was all beige and very bland. Our room overlooked the small alley in the front of the hotel rather than the courtyard, but the windows were well soundproofed and we never had a problem with noise. The breakfast was the best we had on our trip, with a wide selection of fresh fruit, eggs and bacon, pastries, cold cuts, etc. The outdoor terrace wasn't open when we were there due to the spotty weather; that was a disappointment b/c it was full of charm and would have been a lovely setting for breakfast. The service was friendly and the hotel arranged a private car service for our early-morning trip to the airport. It was only 50E and we considered it a much better deal than trying to find a cab at 5:45 am. The only drawback for the hotel was the price (315E per night for the superior triple). The hotel was quite nice, but I felt that we probably could have scouted around more for a similar experience for less money.
