Had it been 65E less per night, I would have considered it a fantastic value for a great little hotel. That is my only reservation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for location and single traveler”
Reviews.Author: bigbird3333
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at the Ponte Sisto. Absolutely terrific location across the river from Trastevere and in walking distance of many attractions. Loved the neighborhood with many restaurants to choose from. I traveled solo. My room was quite small, however, once organized it was fine. Very quiet and lovely view from my room and hotel roof terrace. The hotel front desk staff were mostly very friendly. I think they could have been aware of special events that were happening during my visit--not major concerts, rather small concerts and special art exhibitions. Would stay again. Happy in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Get by the approach for a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jasdvh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week in April. Great hotel and staff and location was just right for the older part of the city and beyond. Rooms were very nice with fresh decor and well appointed bathrooms. Very clean all round. On being dropped off by the taxi the surrounding area of the alley way at first looks to be a bit worse for wear (authentic) but once you get by this you are rewarded by a hotel that provides great value. Would definitely recommend if your budget is in the range of 200-230 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful reception staff - poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Madec
Reviews.Content: Have rarely come across such unhelpful reception staff. Asked for a quiet room and got a room at the street side and when we asked whether it was quiet they just answered: no, it wasn't. Other questions were answered in the same uncooperative way. The so-called king bed was in fact a queen bed and the mattress was far from comfortable. We paid too much for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in many ways. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Ida4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ponte Sisto was a pleasure to stay at. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff is professional and very helpful. The amount and types of food offered for breakfast is amazing. The location, almost next to the Tiber River, makes it easy to get to Trastevere where there are some excellent restaurants and people watching. The hotel is close to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The Forum and the Colosseo are a bit of a walk but not bad. If you don't mind walking you can get to just about anyplace in central Rome. The hotel also has a rooftop terrace which is wonderful at night!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, highly professional, well-placed and not as expensive as it should be”
Reviews.Author: ardentripadv
Reviews.Content: We're well travelled and post a reasonable number of reviews on here, and Ponte Sisto goes pretty close to top of the list at one leap. I would unhesitantly recommend this hotel. We visited for 6 days at Easter (a crazy time in Rome!) and it was the perfect retreat after each enjoyable day out there in the city (don't be put off by its presence in a narrow street with a touch of graffiti, a lot of old Rome is like this and the area is safe as houses.) Rooms and public spaces were immaculately maintained, only a slightly small bedroom being the drawback (but oh, the all-marble bathroom!); service was generally very very good - breakfast was the best we've had in many a hotel, with loads of choice - and the thick walls of this old building and capacious, perfect beds meant undisturbed sleeps. The location issue in Rome is tricky as it depends *what* you want to be close to but for us this is close to perfect: 3 mins from Campo de Fiori, another 3 onwards from there to Piazza Navona or 7 more to the Pantheon. Ponte Sisto is the main bridge across to the chic borough of Trastavere, the city's real / genuine / cheaper-than-touristville nightlife area and the hotel is 50m from the bridge itself (NB on first "taxi" approach get your driver to approach it NOT through the windy pedestrian streets of the old ghetto, now a trendy shopping district, but round the main fast road by the river, dropping you off at the layby by actual Ponte Sisto bridge itself); Vatican City is a beautiful quiet walk along the river of under half an hour and in the opposite direction you can pass the Campodoglio and Forum and reach the Colosseum is about the same time. Lovely lovely place, far less expensive than many hotels this good in this good a location; and if you normally (like us) look for well-rated 3-star instead, this is one of those circumstances to find a few more bucks and upgrade. Well worth it for an indulgent time in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location between Campo Fiori and Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumItalialover
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel, very clean and relaxing, that reflects the atmosphere of Rome. Excellent location between Campo di Fiori and Trastevere. Helpful management and good breakfast buffet. Unfortunately it was too cold during our visit to have breakfast in the superb internal garden.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: CityandCountry
Reviews.Content: All around, a fantastic experience. We accepted their arrangement for airport pickup which was well worth it after a long flight. The hotel is in a great location if you want the Roman experience without being smack dab in the middle of tourist mania. The hotel borders the neighborhoods as well as the main tourist sights making everthing walkable. We could walk to great small restaurants (recommend Ditirambo near Campo de Fiori and Osteria Ponte Sisto in Trastevere) and stop in to hear a set of live music without staying up all night (Big Mama's in Trastevere). The front desk was very helpful in making dinner reservations which we recommend if you have a particular place in mind and are eating anytime after 8:30 pm. We could also walk to the Vatican, the Ancient Rome sights, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, etc. Villa Borghese is a must see but a little further walk. Our deluxe double room was spacious; very clean, all the modern conveniences, quiet with nice views of the building and chuch tops and a small terrace with table and chairs off the bath - perfect for cheese, crackers and wine which we bought at the nearby Campo de Fiori! There was also a rooftop terrace on our floor with views, plants and tables and chairs which seemed open to all guests. I would recommend if your room doesn't have a terrace. As it was still March, their courtyard terrace was beautiful but not yet in use. The breakfast room was comfortable and cheery and offered a wide variety of foods on the buffets. The only recommendation for improvement would be (as others have suggested) to improve the atmosphere of the bar - there isn't any! I imagine in summer, if you can bring your drink to their courtyard, it would be as lovely as was our stay at the Hotel Ponte Sisto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & concierges”
Reviews.Author: TADub
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome and 3 days at Hotel Ponte Sisto. The location is great, the rooms clean, fresh and modern (bed had a nice firm mattress). The view from our 4th floor double was delightful (see attached pic). The concierges were super helpful - hooked us up with a great guide for the Vatican Museum (worth the $$), and suggested two great restaurants (PierLuigi and Ditirambo). We payed $250 per night but we felt it was worth it (for a downtown popular Euro city).The included breakfast had a good selection of items to keep us going until a late lunch. PS don't be put off by the back alley entrance!

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the Frenzy of the City”
Reviews.Author: Phylmont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for a week in March and were impressed with the understated beauty of the place. The lobby was tastefully furnished and fresh flowers graced all of the areas of this hotel. It’s hard to believe that there are 100 rooms in this hotel because it is extremely peaceful, and when we arrived were told that the hotel was completely booked. Our spacious room on the fourth floor overlooked the lovely courtyard, and had a closet which took up an entire wall. There are no dressers in the room, but the closet has shelves for clothes. The marble bathroom was lovely and roomy. The front desk staff graciously helped us daily with directions to the sites and with restaurant suggestions and reservations. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of most sites (a beautiful walk to the Vatican). Everything in the hotel sparkled. Breakfast was plentiful and the food was constantly being replenished. In the breakfast room, we noticed many different languages being spoken, which added to the atmosphere. We had no complaints during our entire week’s stay and we would definitely return to the Ponte Sisto.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: rekdless
Reviews.Content: The room we had was lovely - spacious, clean, air conditioning and looked over the courtyard where we had breakfast. Breakfast was self service buffet with a large range of food to choose from - hot and cold. Hotel had a good location - near Campo de Fiori , easy to get a bus into town, walk to the Vatican (about 40 minute stroll), or jump on one of the city tour buses

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this enchanting area of Rome due to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALLEINA
Reviews.Content: Location: much more than expected; Staff: more than polite & efficient; Room,bathroom,comfort: provide everything needed; Service,breakfast: more than generally usual; Surroundings,sites of interest: more than we were able to absorb... Warmely recommended for whoever wants to experience the authentic Rome,her charming architectural treasures,etc.etc. (Don't miss to note the graffiti on almost all the existing walls).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Rubster
Reviews.Content: Given the price we paid, about 200 Euro per night, the hotel is a great place. We stayed in room 501 which is a corner room with views of St. Peter's and the hills between the Vatican and Trastevere. We also got to watch the thousands of birds undulate through the sky each night at dusk as they settled in the trees along the river for the evening. Wouldn't want to be walking under those trees though :-) We were a few minutes walk from our favorite restaurant in Trastevere. It was also a quick walk to any number of main attractions. The fit and finish in the room was of high quality except for the typical leaky European shower. Breakfast was fine. The staff was very helpful except for the barmaid who forgot about us outside. The one thing they must pay attention to is the bar and outdoor lounge area. The bar needs a redo. It has no people, no vibe. Perhaps another entrance onto the street so they can allow the public in yet protect the privacy of the hotel guests. The outdoor lounge is fine except the metal chairs need some kind of cushion. They were oily so we couldn't sit on them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Live like a local”
Reviews.Author: mtg4
Reviews.Content: Almost all the hotels have a "wonderful" location. It depends on what is wonderful for you. This hotel is around the corner from the Campo de Fiore market. By day it is a colorful fresh food market along with small vendors (leather gloves for 15 euro)! About 2:00 they break the whole thing down, have street cleaning trucks come in, and it is transformed to a beautiful square lined with restaurants and bars. Amazing!! About a five minute walk to Piazza Navona, another spectacular square with amazing fountains, restaurants, and artists. Five minutes the other way, over the bridge, is Trestavare, with dozens and dozens of restaurants, bars, etc. The area is populated with locals and all the cobblestone streets have interesting shops and boutiques. The staff speaks perfect English and are very helpful. The rooms are big by European standards, and the bathroom we had was all marble and HUGE! The included breakfast was generous, with scrambled eggs, meats, homemade pastries, croissants, coffee, etc. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb position, well maintained”
Reviews.Author: alltalk
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is down a small side street well positioned near Campo di Fiori. We both had small but very nice single rooms, with great views and generous bathrooms. It's a shame it was too warm to use the very large terraces we had access to. The staff were efficient and the breakfasts, as mentioned here were very good. Oh, if you get a chance do eat at Al Bric, a five minute walk from the hotel, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: TYOTP
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. If you enjoy walking, it's a great location. 10 to 25 minute walk to most of the famous sites and lots of great places to eat. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. However, we reserved three Doubles (three couples) and all three rooms were different. We had the largest room in #407 with a Courtyard view. 415 was much smaller than ours but had a small balcony. 501 was the smallest with a few steps to climb to get up to the bathroom. The staff doesn't smile much but they are very helpful. Our least favorite meal was one that the front desk recommended. Throw away the guide books when looking for a place to eat. Slowly walk by the restaurants and if they are crowded and everyone is speaking Italian, eat there! Breakfast at the Hotel was very enjoyable but again, not many smiles from the staff. We booked early and the three nights was a total of 780.00 EUR. We'll stay again and ask for room 407.

Reviews.Title: “Final leg of our Italian Odyssey”
Reviews.Author: JanV
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel and while the staff were not warm or friendly, they were competent, effecient and effective - a bit more German than Italian. The rooms were good, roomy enough, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was nice, coffee quite good and and we enjoyed the courtyard setting.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Delight!”
Reviews.Author: CyberAynne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an alley near the Ponte Sisto bridge. Once you enter, you will love its courtyard restaurant and location. Campo dei Fiori is a short walk as is much of ancient Rome. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: fierb0is
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here on the occasion of our 25th wedding anniversary. I mentioned this when booking and the hotel replied "we will make your visit unforgettable". Well, the hotel itself is very nice, very clean and well maintained...the location is ideal for all the major sites. I found the staff, while usually polite, were very impersonal. Despite the fact they knew it was our 25th, they never once mentioned it, no congrats, no bottle of plonk in the room..nothing. We didn't want a pat on the back but it would have been nice to have the occasion acknowledged ( and it would have been a great opportunity for the hotel to get a glowing review) The room was small, common enough I suppose, it was on the top floor with a nice view.(we paid a "£200 supplement for 3 nights for this priveledge) Breakfast was just ok..nothing special...on the last morning at 9am (breakfast stops at 10am) everything in the "hot" servery was stone cold. What put a real dampener on our visit was our departure was that I had asked the hotel to arrange a private car to take us to Da Vinci airport at 1930. While waiting in the hotel courtyard, I overheard a group of english "ladies" (if you're reading this, you know who you are) saying that they had ordered a car to take them to Ciampino but it was held up in traffic. What happened next was. unknown to us at the time, that our car had arrived, on time, but the hotel had allowed the other group to take our car ! The hotel was aware that the booking name was different, the driver knew also and obviously the other people knew....this was a really rotten thing to do. we had to take their car which was 45 mins late and meant a really stressful end to our visit. All in all, the hotel was not worth the money (990 euro for 3 nights) and the guy behind the desk that night(7th oct) showed his complete unprofessionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for seeing all the major sights”
Reviews.Author: Callycam
Reviews.Content: Hidden away in the back streets, this hotel is in a perfect location for visiting all the major sights. Almost everything is within walking distance and there is an abundance of good restaurants nearby. Rooms were small but clean and beds were very comfy. Our room was at the back and it was very peaceful. Helpful staff. Would definately recommend for a weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “we LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Addison833
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 12 nights during an August heat wave - plenty of time for things to go wrong - but absolutely nothing went awry. From the moment we arrived to our check out we experienced friendly and efficient service. The room was spotless, modern, with a fantastic bath/shower and even a small balcony. We were there in extremely hot weather and the A/C worked well. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and tasty with lots of variety: eggs, bacon, cheese, prosciutto, cereal, breads, fruit, fantastic cappuccinos all in a beautiful courtyard setting. We really liked the location - really close to Campo di Fiori, Trastevere and Piazza Navona. We walked to all the sites from the hotel, although I would say that if you aren't into walking long distances you may want to be closer to a metro stop. But it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Class”
Reviews.Author: crazyaboutjazz
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the grubby sidestreet the hotel is on your heart begins to sink but once you're through the low-key understated entrance...Wow! Breakfast in the courtyard is a sheer delight and the coffee is just perfect. There's a quietness and tranquility here which one needs when you're bang in the centre of noisy Rome.The Pantheon,Campo Di Fiori,Trevi Fountain etc are all walking distance and there's a saturation of cheap restuarants over the Ponte Sisto bridge in Trastevere. There's a super little supermarket next door too. Be sure to buy your bottled water there for the trips.Nice little Deli inside too selling Ham & Cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: JBW32
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel just off the man areas and well placed for most sites. Staff very helpfuleven spotted the wife's birthday on he day of arrival and sent abottle of wine. Don't be put off the street it is in when you arrive!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, safe, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireAntrim
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed here in a twin room and I wouldn't have one negative comment to make, it was exactly as described on their website. Our room was spacious and spotless with a lovely bathroom with a window!! something many hotels lack! The staff were lovely and couldn't have been more helpful. I would definately stay there again and highly recommend it. The street where the hotel is situated may look a bit dodgy but the hotel itself is totally safe. The location is totally great as we were able to walk to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking to nearby sites”
Reviews.Author: TazDevilLondon
Reviews.Content: Whether ducking across to Trastevere for dinner or walking to all the major sites in central Rome, this small but classy hotel was a delight. The fact that we picked it up for €110 per night was a real bonus as I've stayed in far worse for more. Staff were courteous, friendly and spoke excellent English. Inclusive buffet breakfast was very pleasant in the cool courtyard. Bedroom was small (as expected) but modern and functional, with a relatively large bathroom. I can't remember a quieter night in a hotel with barely a neighbour heard on the 4th floor. So close to the street but removed from the business of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Noises Off”
Reviews.Author: iliv2golf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto two nights (Aug 9, Aug 10, 2009) as part of a group of about 40 people, adults and teenagers, traveling as a group of families. Our family of two adults and two kids (ages 15 and 11) stayed in rooms 103 and 104. My wife and I were in the larger of the two rooms. It's window opened to the street, just above the entrance to the hotel. Both nights, we were awakened and kept awake by people making lots and lots of noise just outside the hotel. Our windows and shutters were shut (the AC did work, at least adequately), yet the noise was astounding. Each night, the noises woke us after midnight and later. The second night, a great burst of shouting, yelling, and laughing woke us at about 2:30 am. We phoned the desk agent, who assured us they were dealing with the poblem and that we shouldn't worry. Thirty minutes later, still hearing the same noises, we called again. I did not say a word before the voice said, "We've called the police." We were still awake for another 30 minutes. The food was fine and the interior atmosphere was pleasant, and certainly the location is great for moving around Rome. Another member of our group told me that he was discussing the AC problems in his room with the desk agent. I heard the agent assure my traveling colleague that the problem would be taken care of, and then he turned to his fellow employee and, in Italian, according to the traveler, said not to worry about it, because the party was checking out the next day. My traveling colleague then mentioned to the agent that he ought to be cautious about assuming who does and who doesn't understand various languages!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Lebrjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto with our 15 month old in August. Room was large with private terrace and large bathroom. Accommodations were spotless. Breakfast was very good...much better than many of the other hotels we've stayed in on previous trips to Italy, served in a lovely courtyard. Staff was very helpful. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandTrixie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotlessly clean, with lovely breakfast and nice staff. It's across the bridge from Trastevere for your evening meals and nightlife and around the corner is a tram line that brings you to lots of bus stops to take you anywhere in the city. It is not a long walk to all the sights if you prefer to walk. We had a room facing the 'atrium' and with a balcony so was very peaceful, no road noise. The rooms are not huge but are so clean and comfortable, its worth staying here. Would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: dab859
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, good size bathrooms, very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly and the courtyard continental breakfast was wonderful. The hotel was a bit far from most of the major cites so if you are traveling with older people some transportation will be necessary. Overall we loved our stay at the Ponte Sisto Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: kbgmom
Reviews.Content: WOW. What a great hotel!!!!! The location is perfect and many attractions are within walking distance. It's clean, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are a nice size. We stayed in the family wing (rooms 301 & 302). This includes a living area, two bedrooms, two full baths, and a large terrace with table and chairs. By day we toured the beautiful, historic city and by night we enjoyed our time on the terrace with our kids. The front desk was very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. They were able to assist us with many requests .... even one as difficult as finding a restaurant we were looking for that we ate at three years ago. All we could tell them was it was a "no menu" restaurant and the cooks name is Mama Fazzi. I not only highly recommend this hotel but look forward to staying there again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_angel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July with my parents- the vacation being a present for their 20th anniversary. We were upgraded to a suite with a seperate living area and bedroom as well as our own private courtyard which was very much appreciated! The hotel is lovely- relatively new, and the breakfast courtyard is really beautiful. Choices for breakfast are varied, although we did find that the staff at breakfast did take some time to replace the dishes once food had run out. The location of the hotel is relatively good- you are about 10 minutes walk from the Pantheon and a half hour from the Coloseum, which might seem like a lot but when you have so many other sites to see along the way it really isn't all that far! However do keep in mind if you're traveling with older people some money might be spent getting to major sites by taxi unless you try your hand at using the public transport bus lines!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: WhereAreMyGlasses
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in excellent location. Rooms were spotless and nicely decorated with marble bathrooms and full tub. Full breakfast was excellent with wide variety, serving coffee and heated milk in thermoses or espresso coffees upon request. We had a 2-room family suite on 5th (top) floor which was very convenient -- the larger room had a small private balcony (albeit entry from bathroom). There is a nice interior garden courtyard off the front lobby. Front desk was helpful with dinner recommendations and reservations. Suggest contacting hotel directly or use hotel web site for better value and specific requests. Felt this hotel offered a good value considering location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-run hotel in fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGIraffe
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Ponte Sisto. At the start of our trip, I stayed for four nights in a double room with my nine year old son, and then, at the end of our trip, for two nights in a suite with my huband as well. I booked both of these rooms on-line, one on Orbitz and one on Expedia. These rates were half of what the hotel charges on their web-site. The double room was a fine size with a nice bathroom and a lovely view onto the courtyard. The suite was, of course, much bigger with a pull-out in one room for our son, and a king bed in the other for myself and my husband. There was also a large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub, and a large walk-in closet. My only disappointment was that there was no balcony as I had expected. As it turned out, it did not really matter. One can just go sit in that lovely courtyard. Breakfast in the courtyard was good. One tip is to order a capuccino or a caffe latte. You will not be charged extra. The coffee they give you otherwise is not very good. It was very convenient to have a bar in the hotel. Lovely to come back from dinner and be able to enjoy a cognac in the courtyard. Or to enjoy a cold drink after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is definitely child friendly. Full of families. The concierge gave us a guide with a list of things to do with kids in Rome. My son loved the children's museum. We had to go back for a second visit. Everything there is in Italian and in English. The Time Machine movie was fun also. In addition, we just happened upon an interactive exhibit of Leonardo's machines in the Palazzo della Cancelleria. We arranged a private tour of the Coliseum through Vatican Tours, recommended by the hotel. It was a ninth birthday present for our son that we all three really enjoyed. We loved the hotel's location. Last year, we stayed in the Piazza della Rotunda which was fine, but quite touristy. The beauty of the location of the Ponte Sisto is that it is near to many tourist attractions, but does not feel touristy. It is a lovely stroll up the elegant via Giulia to the bridge that leads to the Castel Sant'Angelo. From there, it is another short stroll to St. Peter's. Starting again from the hotel, it is an even shorter stroll across the Ponte Sisto to reach Trastevere. In the other direction, it is a short stroll to the Campo dei Fiori and, further along, to the Piazza Navona. In terms of nearby restaurants, we went several times to Pierluigi's which is just up the via Giulia on the Piazza dei Ricci, and also twice to Sabatini's which is on the Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere. (Honestly, I have found the food in Rome to be a bit hit or miss. That is why we chose to return to the restaurants where we had had good experiences.)

Reviews.Title: “two balconies with great view”
Reviews.Author: lulukas86
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room (no. 601) is very comfortable w/ two balconies, great view, bathtub w/ jacuzzi. Hotel bar was always open during schedule indicated, breakfast was not too bad - breakfast in the room is free of service charge, staff very friendly and helpful, excellent location, close to many nice little piazzas, restaurants but also many sights in walking distance .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: D_Puppet
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Ponte Sisto at the start of a two-week Italian vacation. From the minute we arrived at the hotel we were treated excellently (and I strongly recommend taking advantage of the 55 euro car service from the airport to the hotel--even if we had to wait a few minutes to find the driver). The room, while small (in Italy they're always small), was ready when we checked in at 10 am, and it was clean, quiet (even in the back, over the kitchen), and made up even before we got back from the excellent unlimited buffet breakfast (eggs, meat, cheese, breads, the works). The marble bathroom was also large. The staff is uniformly terrific; someone at the front desk even helped set up our rented cell phone. It's true that there were only 2 channels of English TV, but that's really all you need. I don't know about wifi or other computer hookups, but it seems like there was free ADSL. Also, the location was fine but could have been more central, or closer to the subway; buses run nearby but they were always packed. Campo di Fiore is close, but really more of a party-scene place. On Saturday night the streets around the hotel had broken beer bottles everywhere. (Ignore the graffiti on the walls outside--it's everywhere in Italy.) It's a 25-minute walk to the Spanish Steps, 15 minutes to ancient Rome, 10 minutes to Piazza Navona; walkable, but make sure to have sturdy shoes. That said, we couldn't find any hotel closer to central Rome with the reviews this one got, even at 230 euro a night, and all the good reviews were true. We'll definitely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Gem in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: windspouse
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel in many ways. Yes, small rooms, but very well appointed. Great breakfast that is rarely offered in Europe. They had no problem with a 10 am check-in. A lovely courtyard to relax. LOCATION! You cannot find a quieter hotel so close to the Campo, Trevi and Navonna. Rooms are expensive in Rome, and this one wasn't a fabulous value, but you will not find a better spot. Free wi-fi here will save a few euro and the good news is food and wine are relatively cheap in Rome, so that said, it all works out. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced, tiny luxe rooms--not great value.”
Reviews.Author: nancyandashesh
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a trip to Amalfi Coast and Capri. LOCATION. The location is absolutely unbeatable--10 min walk to Pantheon, 5 mins to Piazza Navona or Campo dei Fiori or Trastevere, 15 mins walk to Forum/Colosseum. Supermarket right next door for snacks, wine, cold water, and goodies to take home! It IS a lovely oasis--cool and quiet, with an attractive courtyard. ROOM. But for E240 a night, the most expensive place we stayed in by almost 100 Euros, we were disappointed in our room. Everything was luxurious, but the room was so tiny there was barely enough room to walk around the bed without turning sideways (we're average sized people, BTW). The bathroom was all marble and very luxe, but I literally (though we decided not to take a photo of this) sat on the toilet with one foot well into the shower, the other foot on the sink, and my knee in the bidet. Seriously. When we checked in, the attendant said he was giving us a room with a lovely courtyard view. We had a balcony, but it was the roof of the building below, separated with iron railing between four rooms--and one of the balconies ran the length of the others, blocking the other three rooms from having a view of anything other than some attractive rooftops and windows. And water poured down from the rooftop onto the balcony next to ours--though there was no rain--kinda wierd. Also, starting at 7 am on Sunday morning, the maid was vacuuming the hallway and moving furniture overhead loudly enough to wake up my hubby, who sleeps like the dead. He even called to complain. VALUE. Our traveling companions stayed near the train station at a hotel E100 cheaper that wasn't as luxurious, and not the same location, but the room was comfortable and sounded about the same size as ours. It's up to you as to how important location is: if I could find a lesser priced hotel in this same area, I'd stay there in a heartbeat. We only had one full day in Rome, and wanted to maximize our time by staying in a central location. FOOD. The breakfast was enormous--yogurt, eggs, sausage, fruit, cappuccino/espresso to order, etc, etc. Very nice quality. Ate at L'Insalata Ricca (a Roman chain)--great selection and really good food--and super cheap! Also ate at Sacro e Profano, in a converted church near Trevi Fountain--excellent. And I highly recommend the olives at the supermarket next door.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ponte SIsto is an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: jamesunt
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here during May and loved the Hotel. It is in the perfect location which offers about a 25 minute walk to St. Peters and within walking distance to the Coleseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps etc. The two rooms that we had were excellent and always immaculate and comfortable. The buffet breakfast in the courtyard was perfect and offered hot dishes as well as the traditional European fare. The staff accomodated our every wish and even stored our four large suitcases on our departure day. Everything was 5 star and I would wholly recommend this hotel for your trip to Rome. The only drawback would be that the streets surrounding the hotel are lined with garbage and grafitti as most are in Rome although once you enter the Hotel you are in an Oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: FriarBri
Reviews.Content: This is a splendid hotel with a great location within walking distance of many sights/attractions in Rome. The place is very clean and modern, and the staff was top notch professional, efficient, and friendly. The central courtyard is charming, and there is also a nice little bar off the dining room if you want a quick drink before you go out. Breakfast is outstanding, with every choice you can imagine, and there is a great wait staff that is very friendly and attentive. I did not feel like bringing my laptop with me so there was a computer in the lower lobby to for email and other internet access. The rooms are small as you would expect, but very clean and modern. I would definitely stay here again, and I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel with a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value not great”
Reviews.Author: cpm1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights at 240 eur/night, which is not bad for Rome but about 100 more than I think it's worth. The location is great and the hotel is very clean, but my room was small and simple (good bathroom though). The hotel lost my reservation but luckily there were spare rooms when I arrived. Breakfast was above average and staff were very polite. I'd consider staying here again simply based on its proximity to Trastevere and Campo dei Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Vatican,Trastevere, Patheon, Campo De Fiori and more”
Reviews.Author: paulnj26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great location for the Vatican, Trastevere, Patheon, Campo De Fiori and Piazza Navona. They are walking distance with these places. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room that we stayed is on the 5th flr. with double beds and it was a little small. Breakfast was excellent however, the hours are too short from 7am to 10am. Great place to stay with young people in their 20's and 30's going to bars, dance, dine and meet locals. I saw a few gay people and Trastevere is great place to get lunch, dinner, gelato and italian desserts which is just less than 5 minutes away and just cross the Ponte Sisto bridge. There is one dessert place that sells old cannolis etc. just near after you cross the Ponte Sisto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but on a slightly grotty street”
Reviews.Author: Louie922
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel after checking the reviews on TripAdvisor for a suprise weekend away for my Birthday so I had no pre-conceived ideas. I was extremely impressed when we arrived, it was truly lovely, modern, clean and finished to a high standard. The breakfast is excellent and plentiful, with lots on offer particularly if you like more traditional English fare. The staff are all friendly and helpful. If there was anything I was disappointed about it was the street the hotel is on - graffiti lines the walls, the cobbled street is a path of sand in places and often litter strewn about (but its not by any means unsafe or dodgy, it just needs some TLC) . But within a minutes walk along the road you're in the hustle and bustle of it all. Had the hotel been located on a better road, it was undoubtedly be pricier so not a complaint as such. Would I recommend Hotel Ponte Sisto? Most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Location, Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italy_One
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and this hotel is perfectly located in the most romantic area of the city. We stayed 6 nights. The staff was very helpful and polite. The hotel is in a pedestrian-friendly zone, so traffic noise at night (a common complaint) is non-existent. We walked everywhere and experienced fantastic coffee, bakeries, pizza, trattorias, sites, boutiques...basically everything you need in Rome for a week. The breakfast is really great, too. I wish we had been there during warmer months so that we could enjoy the beautiful courtyard -- maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, great breakfast, great with small child”
Reviews.Author: MegBoston
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with our 6 year old son for 4 nights in Feb 2009- perfect location, quiet but close to Campo di Fiori and Travestere, we walked to everything Colloseum, Vatican, they upgraded us to a suite and we had a lovely 2nd room for our son, beds were comfortable, huge bathrooms with big tubs and shower, little patio area off the room, breakfast had lots of hot coffee, scrambled eggs, ham, croissants, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, very helpful english speaking staff, we would stay here again in a minute! we got a great deal on the price booking directly with the hotel, ask about off season deals and upgrades- they allowed early check-in at 10am with no problem, sent a driver for 55euro to pick us up at the airport and this was worth every penny to have someone show up and bring us directly to the hotel, would definately not want to drive myself in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: Lalola99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Ponte Sisto in Rome. What a wonderful hotel! The staff was great and went out of their way to make our stay memorable. I have a bad back and they accomodated me by changing the mattress to one I was comfortable with. A truly amazing staff! The breakfast was great and plentiful. The location was also fantastic. A minute across the bridge and your in Trastevere and in the other direction just minutes from the Piazza Navona, Campo d'Fiori and the Pantheon. From outside the main doors the hotel does not appear to be anything special, but once you enter through the doors you find marble floors and a beautiful and inviting Roman courtyard filled with palm trees and flowers. It was incredibly peaceful and quiet. Our room looked out at the courtyard and was a good size with a large and luxurious marble bathroom. What a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: sam241289
Reviews.Content: My Father recently booked this hotel for me and my family and I can't give it enough credit, it was truly perfect. As a family we had come away for an October break and the hotel hooked us up with the fifth floor suite as it was my parents 25th wedding anniversary and the terrace that came with the suite was unbelievable and you could stay there for hours simply looking over Rome and you could see the top of the Vatican from there also. Honestly I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for excellent staff service, an amazing unlimited breakfast, views and the location was sport on, with restaurants and shops minutes away, although it was not noisy which was great. If all of us had the chance to go back we wouldn't hesitate; opening the shutters up in the morning and looking over Rome is a sight you will never forget. It is truly an experience you have to go for!!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: aurora1999
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I recently spent 4 nights at the Ponte Sisto during our honeymoon. It was a wonderful place to stay! We had no problems checking in, and our hotel room was really gorgeous. we had a beautiful balcony, from which we had a great view of the city over to St. Peters. It was really lovely. My only complaint about the room was that there was no stand up shower, but fortunately, I knew that going in. The location of the hotel is really amazing. We were close to the Campo de Fiori and the Piazza Novona, which were amazing squares with many good restaurants. From the hotel, we were able to walk to the Vatican, the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, the Roman Forum and the Circus Maximus. Plus, we were right across the river from Trastevere, which also had the most wonderful places to eat! I really loved this hotel. It was clean, chic and quiet - despite how noisy Rome can be. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Daisyring
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel in mid September. When booking I had mentioned it was for our 25th wedding anniversary and on arrival there was a complimentary bottle of champagne. The standard double room was a reasonable size with enough storage and there was a huge bathroom. The bed was firm and comfortable. As the weather was around 25 C the air condtioning was fine. There was plenty for breakfast and catered for all tastes from cereals, fruits and pastries to scrambled eggs, sausages & bacon. The location was a big bonus. We walked everywhere from the hotel and enjoyed the character of the local narrow streets. Every evening we walked over the bridge to have dinner in one of the many places in Trastevere which were good value. We shopped for fresh bread, fruit and meats in the little supermarket a few doors up so that we could eat cheaply at lunch time. It was safe to fill up a water bottle from the many fountains around the city. The only down side was the cost and if we were returning with our children then i dont think we could afford to stay here but as a special weekend get away for the two of us it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: MarekWNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay in a double room with a put-up bed for our son. On arrival we were upgraded to a big suite – excellent start. Staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. Lovely, peaceful courtyard to retreat into; fantastic central location. Rooms very clean; decor a bit fusty, but this doesn't adverstise itself as a boutique hotel. Highy recommended,

Reviews.Title: “Great hideaway in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: kalimata
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great holiday in Italy. Stayed at the Ponte Sisto in Rome which was just perfect. It's located fabulously, just a few minutes from Campo di Fiori and a short walk from Trastevere across the Ponte Sisto (bridge). The room was comfortably sized with a view of the courtyard, (nothing imaginative in the decor) the beds are firm and the granite finished bathroom was a very generous size (for Rome standards) with a bathtub and a large window! The best part was the charming courtyard where breakfast - a spread of eggs, variety of breads, meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal, espresso coffee (you have to ask for it) - was served. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: jwilli3470
Reviews.Content: On the positive side the hotel is modern, safe and attractive. The staff is efficient and courteous, if not especially friendly. The AC might have been good enough for most people and they also had a large electric fan I used. It is about 4 blocks to a square with many major bus routes. breakfast is served outside in a nice courtyard and is bountiful if a little boring (same thing every day). On the negative side, I found the hotel pricey. I would have liked some feature like a small pool to justify the cost. I have lived and travelled extensively in Europe. My single room while well designed was perhaps the smallest I have ever had. The hotel was clearly not full and I stayed 8 nights so they could have easily put me in a double room. There were no drawers. Suitcases had to go under the bed which was one hard mattress on a wooden frame. The bathroom was modern but not designed well so the door presented a problem. The room had one ill-placed window so it was dark. I had no chair. The courtyard is beautiful but fairly boring. No one was ever there except for breakfast. I would have preferred a roof top setting or outside bar to people watch. The courtyard would be nice if you had small kids or family staying in several rooms. I stayed in the Albergo del Senato Hotel beside the Pantheon in Dec. I liked that hotel and the that area much better. Campo de Fiori near the Ponte Sisto was mostly tourist trap restaurants filled with Americans and Australians. In short, I might go back to Sisto Ponte but only for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: randknew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel June 15-20, 2008 and enjoyed every aspect of it. the room was lovely, good sized for European standards, lovely linens & very clean. the bathroom was big and had a window which i enjoyed. the courtyard area for breakfast was beautiful and i thought the breakfast was very nice, both cold & hot selections and great coffee in a pot on our table every morning. the staff was wonderful, very attentive and the location was our favorite! easy walking to plenty of cafes, gelatto, sites, shopping. We can not wait to return to Rome & this hotel. thanks to Trip Advisor i found it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: tsmlink
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Rome. It was also our first international trip. We selected the Hotel Ponte Sisto based on the reviews we read on TripAdvisor. Having heard some of the horror stories that travelers face in Rome hotels, we just wouldn't take a chance on booking some of the lower priced hotels with mixed reviews. We looked for a hotel where the reviews were almost 100% positive. For the most part, the reviews of the Hotel Ponte Sisto were spot on. The hotel's location is just a block from the Tiber and the Ponte Sisto bridge, which leads into Trastevere. Trastevere is loaded with restaurants, many of which are recommended on TripAdvisor and in other guide books. If you like to eat, then you won't be disappointed. As far as its location to the major sites, it's a bit off the beaten path, although we did a walking tour of the Colosseum, Pantheon, and the Forum completely on foot that originated from the hotel. Other attractions like the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps may require a taxi for some people. The hotel itself is clean and modern, both in the common areas and the rooms (we were in a standard room). The room itself is a bit on the small side, but that's in comparison to a standard U.S. room; we don't know how it compares to a typical room in Rome. The bathroom is beautiful, but European towels leave something to be desired (hand towels are paper thin and if you're used to using washcloths, you'll have to bring your own, as they don't offer them). Clothes storage is a bit on the limited side (only three small drawers) and they could use a few more outlets at the desk. There is a dual voltage outlet in the bathroom, but it seems to have fried my battery chargers. The A/C worked fine while we were there so sleeping was comfortable. The buffet breakfast is served in a beautiful outdoor courtyard and was certainly adequate for a good start to the day. Some other reviews have mentioned that the front desk staff is not the friendliest, but it depends on who you deal with; some are friendlier than others, and as long as you don't have any problems, this is a non-issue. If you are looking for a quality hotel near Trastevere, the Ponte Sisto is a great choice. If we return to Rome, we will likely search for a similar quality hotel to the Ponte Sisto, but in a more central location...so we won't have to spend quite as much on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Global8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for a week in February of 2007. My wife found it on the internet and thought the reviews were good, but one never knows. It turned out to be one of the best European hotels we have stayed in and we have stayed in quite a few. Excellent location, just a few streets away from the Campo de Fiore, Piazza Farnese. With a few exceptions, you can walk to most of the main locations in the City. The rooms were more than adequate, clean and comfortable with a terrific (all you could hope for ) breakfast every morning. The best part of the hotel was the staff ( front desk, breakfast room, concierge, doorman) who were always available and glad to be of service to assure your stay was all you expected. It's not the least expensive, but for the rate we paid, it was excellent value. It's the kind of hotel that once you've stayed there, you will never again have to look for another hotel in Rome, it's where you'll stay every time you return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Slothrop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in mid-May. It's a perfectly fine hotel, in an excellent location. My room was rather small, but otherwise not bad-- the bathroom in particular was excellent, modern, granite counters, a good shower, etc. There wasn't much room to store on'es clothes in the room, and there weren't enough electrical outlets by the desk, so that recharging (e.g.) a computer was tricky. The garden is very nice. The breakfasts were quite good. The staff seemed efficient but not particularly friendly. The location is excellent: very close to many of the nicest parts of Rome. My room opened onto the (narrow) street -- not much of a view, but OK. It gets quite noisy on that street at night, but with the windows closed it wasn't really a problem. When I first arrived the room was warm, and the advertised air conditioning didn't seem to work; when I complained at the front desk, they said it wasn't turned on until later in the summer. But two days after I realized the a/c set up so that it only turns on if the windows are closed, and at first I had had them open. I don't know if it really had been working at first... Anyway, a fine place, great location, nothing special otherwise, but perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Some "Reservations"”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: Ponte Sisto is located in a great part of town, close to all the sites while retaining a lot of Roman charm. We stayed in a standard room which was small and clean...nothing amazing. We experienced TWO PROBLEMS during our short stay, air conditioning and the front desk staff. During our stay the weather became quite warm. Thinking there was a problem with our a/c unit (it didn't work) I asked the front desk to send up an hotel handyman. They informed me that the air conditioning is only switched on when the manager deems it necessary ... I took numerous trips to the front desk in order to get it activated, their response being that the manager makes his decision on a daily basis and that they had no authority (the manager wasn't there so couldn't speak face to face). The John Malkovich "look a like" on the front desk was the rudest hotelier I've ever met. He just told me in a matter of fact way that it wasn't his problem and that I'd have to wait for the manager. If you go to this Hotel and have limited contact with the staff, you'll have a great time. Just don't expect any cooperation if you need help. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RozeParis
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Rome with our 7 years old son, and we loved our stay at hotel Ponte Sisto. We had a suite, which was huge and very quiet. The hotel is perfectly located, we walked everywhere with our son. There is no restaurant in the hotel but accross the brige is the Trastevere, which is the best place to have dinner in Rome. The staff is very helpful, the breakfasts are quite good (for Italian standards), there is a lot of choice and it is really nice to be eating outside in the garden. We've already been to Rome several times and it is by far the best hotel we've been in.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!”
Reviews.Author: thejuljul
Reviews.Content: THis was a wonderful location. We went with my family (12 people) for our parnets 50th weddig anniversary. It was our first trip there . Friends who had lived there recommended this hotel for the location and service. We booked 5 rooms there for 4 nights. The breakfasts were very good, the service was also very good. We could walk to many restaurants, cafes and shopping areas. The price was a little high because of the euro conversion- but all in all it was worth it. We had a room with a a beautiful terrace overlooking the street over the rooftops. Even though we were close to the street we slept well in the comfy beds with our windows open. The bathrooms are great also. I would go back- no one had a complaint! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: SGP_Kent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto over the bank holiday weekend for my partner's birthday surprise. It was her first visit to Rome but I spent time there some 9-10 years ago. Knowing the layout of the city I was very keen to find a good hotel in the most accessible location and spent many hours trying to find the optimum place. We were not disappointed. Locationwise it was ideal, equal walking distance to all the main sites. In the evennings there were plenty of eating, drinking and people watching places closeby, within a few minutes walk. We would recommend walking across the bridge into Trastevere for the better value eating places. We can not speak highly enough of the staff who were all helpful, particularly the reception staff. My partner had the misfortune to have her bag snatched late one night and the reception staff were brilliant helping us out with the police matters. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: ijnlg
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located just off Campo di Fiori right at the Ponte Sisto leading across the Tiber to Trastevere. An oasis of calm and elegant old-world charm with beautiful vistas from the marvellous rooftop-terrace. Some of the immaculate rooms with their spotless marble bathrooms face a beautiful inner courtyard, from others you can even see St. Peter's Church. I attend an annual conference in Rome so have been there three times and will definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Don't think of staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SBrantley
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! It just might be in the best location in Rome; you can walk to the Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona and Pantheon; cross the bridge to Trasteverre or walk out the door and to the cross-street for a 5 minute bus ride on the 23 to the Vatican. The 116, which hits all the major sights in the city, also stops on the nearby Via Guila. The rooms are small by American standards but they are incredibly well lit and exceptionally clean. We had a room that overlooked the courtyard; it was quiet and peaceful and the view was magnificent. And I have to mention the incredible staff. They might just be the nicest people in all of Rome. When asked a question, they took as much time as needed to explain the answer. If you stay here, be sure to go right around the corner and eat dinner at Da Sergio. Dinner for two with wine and two courses (but no desserts) came to under 40 Euro and the food and service is terrific. If you're looking for afternoon pastry or late night coffee, walk five minutes to the Campo di Fiori and try any of the cafes (except Magnolia which is a tourist rip-off). The Ponte Sisto is right in the heart of everything and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Lovely Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: gangwayjan
Reviews.Content: We had the best room in the house: It was somewhat small by US standards -- but the 3 wraparound roof top terraces, views of City, including St Peter's, the private lemon and orange trees and the grand marble bath made up for the interior lack of space. Sunsets with our Compari and sodas were just the thing after our day of touring. The quiet street location made it a perfect place to relax from Rome's bustle. It's location to the sites and markets and restaurants made taxis almost unecessary. The breakfasts were good and the staff helpful. The bartending service was a little odd -- but we didn't stay there for the bar. Would I go back again? Heck -- I'd live there if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Barcha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice 4 night stay at Ponte Sisto this past February. We always received prompt attention from the staff and were very happy that we were able to check in at 9:30 in the morning. Nice room facing the courtyard and large well appointed bathroom. Very good breakfast choices,not a huge spread, but more than enough cold and warm choices to keep one satisfied regardless of preference. Good, fast internet connection in the room (included in room price). Tv channel choices are very limited, but who cares right? Excellent location to visit any and all sites in Rome. We were able to go back to the room and rest for a couple hours and or rest and change for dinner. Trastevere restaurants were a 5 min walk from our room. We recommend this hotel to one and all, and if we decide to stay close to the ancient /tourist sites again this will be our first and hopefully last phone call. To be fair, I can see where the rooms facing the street can be a little noisy as other reviewers have pointed out,but this is pedestrian noise . It is young people returning to their homes from Trastevere or Campo de Fiori. A great stay for us. We rate it as excellent among hotels of its class and are not quite certain why its only listed as a 3 star property by tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful ponte sisto”
Reviews.Author: tmaggie
Reviews.Content: just back from 4 day stay at ponte sisto hotel. reviews were good so i was hopeful, and i was not disappointed.The hotel is situated down a narrow road that looks gloomy initially but reveals itself later and as soon as i entered the hotel i had the feeling of being in a wonderful roman dwelling exuding elegance and calm . reception staff pleasant and very willing to speak english. room was really lovely with a small balcony looking out over a garden. the bathroom was stylish ,the bedroom well furnished with large double bed. the room was very clean and towels and bed linen all immaculate and changed daily. I found the mattress just a bit too firm but my husband loved it.after walking the streets of rome everyday it was a real pleasure to return to the luxury of the hotel. wonderful roof top terrace with lovely views , and downstairs garden area both of which seemed so welcoming but unfortunately it rained for 2 days of our stay so we didn't fully use them.definitely recommend the ponte sisto.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful ponte sisto”
Reviews.Author: ronnie1234
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel , great staff, first rate breakfast and a very good location.It is very expensive but in Italy the value for money concept does not apply.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel61
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto is perfect. It is a nice oasis from the busyness of Rome. The breakfast had a nice spread and the employees were always helpful and friendly. The entire hotel is spotless. I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carriger
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ponte Sisto had been recommended by a friend & tripadvisor reviews looked good so 12 of us booked individually for a week in January. All were very happy with the hotel. Friendly helpful English speaking staff. Nice lounge/bar area to meet up & chat. Nice room with a very good bathroom;linens changed regularly. Great location-two minutes from Campo di Fiori; five minutes from Trastevere. We estimated that most sights in Rome were within 30 minutes walk. Restaurants within five minutes walk; those recommended by hotel reception were very good. Don't be put off by the narrow cobbled street outside with graffitied shuttered windows - behind the shutters are very good jewellery shops. There is a good mini supermarket a few doors from the hotel. When we return to Rome Ponte Sisto will be top of our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: daybird
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ponte Sisto worked out great for my wife and I and our first trip to Rome. The location is amazing, between the Colessuem, Vatican and Trestavere, yet still in the heart of ancient Rome. (and not too close to the commercialized Spanish Steps) We walked a lot during our week in Rome and the hotel was a perfect base. The staff was excellent and met everyone one of our demands or needs. The room was small, clean and had just enough personality and style to make our stay a comfortable Roman experience. We were so so with the breakfast; getting a genuine cappucino and pastry a few doors down for very cheap was more appealing to us than the bright lights and tight confines of the PS breakfast buffet. As always there is a little trepitude in making hotel arrangements for your first trip in a foreign city but Hotel PS worked out great, I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sverrir
Reviews.Content: The hotels biggest asset is location not to draw from the hotel ameneties. A stones throw from the bridge to bustling Trastavere with all it´s resturants. Also the markets and outside cafés by the river are well worth visiting. It´s true that access to public transport isn´t great but most of the tourist sites you´ll want to visit are within walking distance. To lighten your steps, take one of the small buses from Campo di fiori. The room we had was luxurious by any standards, roomy and nice furniture. We certainly didn´t have any trouble with the AC which kept us cool throughout the night. The bathroom was really nice with a shower/bathtub. We made good use of the slippers and my fiancé still uses them at home! Breakfast is good and although we usually came quite late we never had much problems getting what we wanted. The staff was polite and could speak english quite well. They were able to help and answer some questions regarding the city. Accross the street is a little café/shop where you can buy water and snacks for the day ahead or something to nibble on in the room. A good way to start the day is to buy a bottle of water and down some espresso standing by the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with all the ammenities”
Reviews.Author: dmf379
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very helpful staff. Had great rooms, and to die for showers. We stayed there after traveling through Italy for 10 days, and it was a welcome delight. If your looking for a little taste of an Itailian bed and breakfast this is not it. This is a small hotel that is like a Hyatt or another big hotel with out the price. It has a great breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieCrocket
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Ponte Sisto in Nov 2007. It is in a small side street just off the main road alongside the river. The taxi driver from the railway station had no trouble finding it. TIP...If arriving by train get off at Rome East Station not the main Termini as it saves a lot of travel time. The welcome at the hotel was very friendly and staff most considerate. The location is very central and makes it easy to walk to almost every location worth visiting in Rome. Just 20 minutes from the Vatican and even closer to the Colloseum. The room was large and bathroom amenities left nothing to be desired. The cost per night is on par for most of europe for this class of hotel however the location makes it worth every cent. Breakfast each day was very extensive with many selections available including hot cooked choices, well presented and the staff are very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed in Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first Italian stop and I had warned my husband that I did not know what to expect at our hotel. Some of the posters had warned of an entrance off a loud, dirty alley, but I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived in front of this lovely hotel. The alley was not different than any other in the historical district. It may get more foot traffic due to the bridge to Travestere being close by, but I still thought other areas near Pantheon were much busier and louder. We stayed in a suite with a large terrace on the 4th floor for five nights. Unfortunately, due to the colder than normal temps and rain we only used the terrace a few times. I would not pay for this room type again. We did enjoy the large room by Rome standards; it was actually a sitting room and a connecting bedroom. The bedroom had a very large closet with room for two suitcases. The bed and furnishings were ok, not as plush as I expected for over $500/nt. Bed a little hard. The bathroom was amazing though with a jucuzzi tub and beautiful green marble and gleaming fixtures. There were also robes and slippers for our use. No shower, but not a problem with the hand help shower fixture in the tub. Breakfast had a lot of options. Service was prompt. The bar area is small and we only visited it once. The front desk does a nice job and are curteous, but not overly friendly. They do their job well, they are just reserved. They made suggestions and reservations for two restaurants in the Travestere area and both were our best meals on our trip. My only complaint with the hotel and staff is when my husband's knee swelled up twice it's size (ended up needing surgery when we returned home) they would NOT give us ice to put on it. I came down to the bar late at night several times with a zip lock bag and they said they couldn't give us ice. I explained my husband's knee and they said they needed the ice for the chanpagne. I understand it is a small ice maker, but for a 4 star hotel not to give out ice (1 qt!!) or find it for us (I asked the front desk about a place to buy ice in the area and they didn't know of any) I did not think this was acceptable. BTW, ice must be hard to come by because the two markets near the hotel did not sell ice. Super location, max 5 minutes to Campo de Fiori and a few minutes more to P. Navona. Loved the area and would definately stay in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ponte Sisito; another brilliant stop thanks to all those on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: PAndrew32
Reviews.Content: Be afraid, be very afraid!! Not of the hotel, that was excellent, just the mad bad taxi ride from Campaigno airport to the hotel. The hotel itself is well located near Travestere, so is close to all the major sites. Breakfast is good, although do not expect to sit outside in the colder months. There is a good range of breads, pastries, more bread and cereal although the staff are like a swot team when it comes to keeping things clean. After dropping a Coco Pop on the floor, staff lept from all over the place to clean the offending item from the floor. Pity they are not that efficient when it comes to filling up, it does pay to get down to breakfast early. Thanks to another review for this tip. The rooms are well appointed, a big bed, plenty of room and no need for the air conditioning (We couldn't imagine the hotel staff putting it on if it was needed!). Staff were very good at arranging a cab back to the airport of 50 Euro although he did try to squeeze an extra 5 from the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CadeLee
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Ponte Sisto. It was a perfect hotel in Rome. Our room was great--small, but had a beautiful little balcony with a nice view. The bathroom was really nice, too! All new, spacious with nice fixtures. The location was great. We walked to every tourist site. Some places are a little bit of a walk, but if you like walking and seeing the city, then it won't matter. It is also right by the the river and you can walk over the bridge to the neat Trestavere area for dinner. The breakfast is wonderful. It has a little bit of everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: agun21
Reviews.Content: A little pricy but worth it. Location is extremely convenient to historical core of Rome and great dining/nightlife. The rooms are nicely finished and pretty comfortable. Great courtyard and rooftop terrace, but the lobby and bar are undersized and nothing special. Service was very good. My only complaint is no business center/internet access.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: davidleeds
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the choice of the Ponte Sisto in Rome. I booked through a travel agent at an excellent but not cheap "run of the house" rate and it was worth it for the location, comfort and excellent breakfast and the courtyard which was our oasis. We initally had a room overlooking the street and were moved when I told them I had requested a quiet room. We were given a room with a tiny balcony overlooking the courtyard which we loved. It was silent when the doors were shut but it was nice to have the choice of leaving them open to enjoy the warm air. As far as the comments about needing a car to stay here which was in another review the worst idea possible is to have a car in Rome. The location is a 35-45 minute walk from St. Peter's and 45 minutes from the forum area. Taking a taxi is about 8-11 euros. Walking one way lets you explore the city which is what visiting is about. It is also a great walk from the Borghese Gallery via the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. There is an excellent grocery store a few steps from the hotel and putting together a picnic to eat in the courtyard is a great change from eating out.

Reviews.Title: “No compliants”
Reviews.Author: michIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Ponte Sisto for a week in August. I actually had my wedding reception here and the majority of my 45 quests also stayed here. Not one of the group had a single bad word to say about the hotel or its staff. The rooms were lovely, very clean. We only had to ask the staff if we had a problem and it was sorted with minimum fuss. The hotel itself was ideally located,with all the historic sites of Rome a pleasant stroll away.The breakfast was fantasic in the court yard. The only thing we found unpleasant were other over-zealous travellers who seemed to think that they had a right to be served first and eat everything in sight on the breakfast buffet!!!!!. I have no regrets whatsoever about choosing Hotel Ponte Sisto for my wedding breakfast and would not hesitate to return

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: OpAPI
Reviews.Content: The Ponte Sisto is perfectly situated in old Rome, near the wonderful Campo de Fiori.. The rooms are very stylish and clean, with beautiful wood and marble. The staff are very friendly and competent. It isn't cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to come back to after sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a tour group with the University of Dallas. After staying at some barebones hotels in other cities this was quite a step up. For those who complain about the AC, you find this throughout Europe. There is a great emphasis on conserving energy even at the expense of comfort. The room was quite nice, especially the slippers for the guests. The bathrooms were terrific. It was also very close to the Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navona which provided for great nightlife. Also breakfasts at this hotel were terriffic. A bit of trivia, this hotel used to be a monastery that has been converted, in fact you will find a small church right next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Ponte Sisto - Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: nycmiguelito
Reviews.Content: We are a middle age gay couple. The hotel staff is friendly and spoke english. Breakfast at the courtyard was good. Rooms are nice, comfortable and clean. Beds and pillows are great. The A/C is a problem all over Italy. Yes... the temperature is controlled from the main desk and yes the A/C is never enough. The coldest temperature in the room was 70 degrees. We complained and so did all the other guests but nothing was done. The location is excellent. Walking distance to EVERYTHING. It could get a bit loud at night. Specially the young crowd of beer drinkers outside the hotel doors could get pretty loud but once inside the hotel it is pure silence. There is a lot of night action around the hotel. We definitely recommend this hotel. They have some weekend specials. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ponte Sisto for two nights in Sept while on vacation. Pros: **The beautiful, peaceful courtyard, a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Rome. **Great location **Rooms were well-soundproofed **Gorgeous bathrooms. But, a few cons: --the hotel is starting to feel a little threadbare--carpeting and painting in common areas needs redoing, there was a giant 3' stain in the carpet in our room --not very much personality--our room was rather small and kind of boring (except for the bathroom) Overall, I did not think this is really a four-star hotel, or quite worth the price (we paid 250 euros for a double room).

Reviews.Title: “Not what we bargained for”
Reviews.Author: Alberto01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ponte Sisto Hotel in May for four nights. We were in a suite. My daughter and her husband were in a regular room. The hotel was OK, beds were comfortable, but the management was terrible. It was 90 degrees. Unusually warm for May, and the owner refused to turn the air conditioning on. We sweated for two days. Everyone was complaining. The desk clerks said there was nothing they could do. I asked to see the manager, who incidently was the owner; but he refused to see us. I had booked the hotel assuming it had air conditioning, as advertised on its web site. Finally, after 2 1/2 days, the air was turned on, after a series of lies and denials for two days, and two nights. it was unbearable, and my trip to Rome was ruined. We didn't sleep at all. When they finally turned on the air conditioning, I learned that they could control the individual temperature in each room. They had my room so high that I barely got any relief, until finally on the llast night, they adjusted my temperature, from their office. The breakfasts were also not good, and the hotel itself was a maze. They also advertised that you could eat outside, but they never opened it. Stay away from this hotel. The management is terrible, and the employees are scared to death of him. You won't have a good time. i think he writes his own reviews. Nothing this bad can be praised so well unless it is rigged.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value”
Reviews.Author: kukuroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Our room was a decent size, with a king size bed and a large bath facing the street on the fourth floor. The shower leaked through the glass doors all over the floor and pooled into a corner. Also, our internet via Wifi did not work at this location and so we had to use the hotel computer. But the worst thing about our stay was that it seemed too expensive for the location and how loud it was to sleep at night. Its location is on what appears to be an alley and our room faced this street on the fourth floor. It was loud at night and you had to suffer the at times too efficient air conditioning just so that you could drown out the din of loud voices and motor bikes at all ours of the night. The location in terms of its proximity to sites is OK but one could do better in that regard. The staff was nice, the breakfast was pretty good and the courtyard that it is served in is georgeous. If I were to return to Rome, I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Julianne-7
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Hotel Ponte Sisto in Rome and had a very favorable experience. First, the location is very good, close to the Campo Fiore and just steps from the bridge (Ponte Sisto) to the Trastevere section of Rome. We walked everywhere from this location - 35 miles on my pedometer in two and one half days!! Our room was small but big enough for two adults. However, it was very elegant and well appointed. The linens and the furniture were luxurious. We requested both a room facing the courtyard anda bathtub and got both. The bathroom was spacious with a beautiful shower-tub combination. and the fixtures were first class. It was in the inimitable Italian style! We were in room 34 and it was great - small, as I mentioned, but with a tiny balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. It was very quiet and just lovely. I want to thank other TripAdvisor posters for stating that an inside room was important. The breakfast was sumptuous - nothing less -with every imaginable breakfast food, both hot and cold. It was served in the very pretty courtyard. The staff of the Ponte Sisto was friendly and helpful, without pretensions or airs. I felt like I was at a five star hotel.
