All in all, this was a great experience and we would not hestitate to return to this hotel or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Greek7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in mid-July, a party of 8 in 4 rooms. My wife and I had Room 401. It is a suite with a HUGE terrace (over 400 sq ft) that overlooks the interior courtyard. The room itself was a good size for European hotels, with a separate sitting area and lovely green marble bathroom. One thing to note...there is a handheld shower in the bathrub and no shower curtain so you have to kneel in the bathbub to take a shower to minimize the water spraying everwhere. A minor inconvenience all things considered, and since the bathroom is entirely marble, there's no issue with water getting on paintwork or wallpaper. We arrived in our room to a complimentary bottle of wine and fruit basket. Nice touch. The airconditioning was very effective...no problems at all. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful and friendly. They gave us good maps and directions to places of interest. Our travelling companions arrived a day later than we did and we asked the front desk to rearrange an airport shuttle pickup for them due to flight issues, and it went off very smoothly. The interior courtyard where buffet breakfast is served is worth staying at the hotel just for that. It is lovely....separated from the hustle and bustle of Rome, and cooled by strategically placed palm trees. The breakfasts were highly varied and filling (cold cereals, juices, coffee/cappucino, tea, pastries, yogurts, bread for toast, meats, cheeses, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages). We found the hotel to be exceptional for value, and the location can't be beat. A stone's throw from Trastevere, and a 5-10 minute walk to Campo De Fiori and the Pantheon. It's a 20 min walk to the Pantheon. Leisurely 45 min to Spanish Steps/Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: InternatNewYorks
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled through Itlay through July 6th to July 24th. We stayed 5 nights in this hotel and can highly recommend it. Very good international breakfast, great service, very clean and very modern 4 star hotel. Best: LOCATION. It is near Campo di Fiori and in walking distance to the Pantheon. No brainer. Just book it. You won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “So glad we made this choice”
Reviews.Author: pattrink
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Ponte Sisto and we are everso glad that we chose this hotel. After much research we selected this property for its location and amenities and the fact that it is not the Excelsior or Hassler style hotel with several hundred rooms. We wanted a more intimate experience of Rome. Our expectations were exceeded by our Suite (401 ) which had our own personal large terrace. The rooms are elegant and well equipped. Breakfasts are very good and served in a beautiful oasis of a courtyard. The staff went over and above with every request and a taxi is at your door in minutes from their phone call. Ponte Sisto bridge is a stones throw away and the entrance to the Trestevere district - buzzing with local night life and fun dining choices. Most nights we set out on foot and either ate in the Piazza Navona or the Trestevere area. The Jewish Ghetto is a few blocks away, as is Campo Di Fiori. This is a very good Hotel choice and we will definitely stay there again. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast . . .”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyTravelers
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay at the Ponte Sisto. Had not been to Rome since my backpacking days after college about 20 years ago. We are a family of 4 and booked 2 rooms that shared a common hallway entrance. The rooms and bathrooms were very nice and airconditioning was great. One warning -- if you are a light sleeper make sure to reserve a room facing the inner courtyard rather than the street. The hotel sits on the street that is the direct path to Trastavere so you get a fair amount of pedestrian traffic early into the morning. One morning I was unable to fall asleep until 3 am because of the partying going on below. However, the room facing the inner courtyard was silent . . . The courtyard, where breakfast is served is beautiful. And breakfast was the most complete of any that we had in Florence, Venice and Viareggio. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. Walked everywhere from the hotel. Great location at night with Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiore close by. Supermarket next door is convenient when you lose a toothbrush or want to stock up on bottled waters. Restaurants we recommend -- Maccheroni, Pier Luigi. We have been told by the locals that the best pizza is at Baffeto, but it was closed the day we tried to go there. Sites not to miss that aren't listed in the major tourbooks -- Church of St. Clemente -- actually 3 churches built on top of each other with excavations of the 1st church from 1 A.D. Church of the Immaculate -- bones used from 4000 Franciscan monks to adorn several chapels -- incredible and the kids loved it in a bit of a creepy way. Had a great time in Rome -- we would definitely stay there again unless we could find a well located hotel with a pool. I think my 13 and 10y.o kids would have loved a place to jump into water even if it was only for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DBL960
Reviews.Content: Great staff that will help you with every requests. The rooms were great and very clean but try not to get a room next to the street. The breakfast was excellent and their staff would make you special eggs or bacons or coffee if you ask. Great location to access many of the sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LeqTra
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel directly to book a large group booking and they responded immediately with the best room rates and information on transfers from the airport. The hotel is in an excellent location. The terrace is lovely to relax in after a day of trecking the many attractions Rome has to offer. Breakfast selection was great however one waiter was rude! Rome is a beautiful city and i will definately return and would have no hesitations returning to the Hotel Ponte Sisto. I will not however return to the Bramante Restaurant off the Piazza Navona (Via Della Pace) fIt looks lovely as it is surrouned by fairy lights however the food and service was horrendous and the owner is extremely rude - after complaining that we had recieved 2 frozen fillet steaks we were met with a barrage of abuse! He admitted he did not care if we enjoyed the food because he relies on tourists and therefore does not have regulars to impress!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Waiter”
Reviews.Author: Paullivingstone1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for 4 nights with my partner from the 12th to the 17th of July. The location and the Hotel were fantastic and most of the staff were friendly. However one morning when i turned up for the buffet breakfast i was confronted by a very rude waiter who clearly had no customer service skills. We were apologised to by another member of staff for his behaviour and the next morning the rude waiter was nowhere to be seen. I hope he got fired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussieches
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome yesterday. Our last three nights were spent at the Hotel Ponte Sisto. We found the hotel to be so convienent location wise. The courtyard is a lovelly haven far from the madness that is Rome in the summer. The breakfast that was served here in the morning was excellent with a large selection. We also had several dinners (picnic style) in the courtyard. Just a few doors up is a little market and we also bought fruit and vegtables at the Campo Fiore morning market. It was a delightful get-away. The rooms were clean and the fresh flowers sprinkled around the hotel were a nice touch. I did use ear plugs and would advise others to always travel with them especially Italy. Staff spoke good English and were helpful and friendly. It cost us 55 euro to taxi to the airport, and it was organized by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelfan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Ponte Sisto while visiting Rome. It is a very clean and comfortable hotel, and the staff is very helpful. We were impressed with our room overlooking the hotel's courtyard, and the bathroom was outfitted in marble and other reviewers have noted. Our room was kept very tidy by the daily maid service. They provide a vanity kit, shower cap as well as shampoo and bath gel...I recommend packing your own conditioner if you need it. The only thing I feel compelled to mention was our shower was on the tiny side. It was an enclosed shower which I imagine could be a bit of a challenge for a larger person. Could have just been our room...I suppose you could check with the desk about this upon booking. Also, they have the most delightful courtyard at this hotel where they service a morning breakfast (I believe it is open to all guests). It was fantastic not having to think about breakfast plans and the selection was terrific! Follow the reviews on this site and book a room at this lovely hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “we would return here”
Reviews.Author: foofoo28
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from 2 nights in Rome and spent it here. Although it wasnt my first choice originally, we are so glad that we stayed here. The hotel and staff are welcoming, everyone we met there said hello and that makes you feel welcome in itsself. i asked for a quiet room with a balcony and thats what i got. although the balcony is very small, it was very nice to have the doors open and to stand overlooking the courtyard. everything else in the room is modern and clean. the shower was wonderful after a long days sightseeing . breakfast is taken in the courtyard and this was the highlight of our stay. the food is very nice - the usual array of bread, pastries and friut and yogurt. there was also bacon, sauage and scrambled eggs. this set us up nicely for the day. the hotel is just over the bridge from the tratsevere area which is where we wanted to be. it is full of places to eat and drink, little market stalls and lots of people just enjoying the atmosphere. its a great place to people watch and feels very safe. the main sights are around a 30-40 minute walk away but this was not a problem for us as we were quite relaxed and knew we could not fit everything into 2 days. the beauty of rome is that every corner you turn there is something of interest to see and we saw so much by walking. However, do take comfy shoes as the cobbles can be quite hard on the feet. we did however catch a taxi from the colloseum to our hotel which only cost us 6 euros. some people complain that Rome is dirty and full of grafitti - well it is a working city and the grafitti does shock you a little but it is a place that has captured my heart and i cant wait to return. for all the ladies; i was quite concerned about what to wear. most people in the day wear shorts and t'shirt style tops. in the evening, the same again, alot of crop trousers and jeans and vests. however, everyone is smart looking. i did not see anyone - tourist or local dressed like scruffily. smart casual - seems to be the way. We definatly recommend rome as a destination and the hotel ponte sisto.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle Free for all the family”
Reviews.Author: theritters
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This is in the perfect place to see the sites of Rome. I took my 72 year old mother and two teenagers and I wanted to be able to walk everywhere. We did take the occasional taxi in the morning but nothing was more than Euros10.- and the hotel orders them for you. The hotel is functional and correct with fully working bathrooms, good beds and pleasant corridors. This is not a romantic getaway or hotel to impress but the courtyard for breakfast is delightful and for a cup of tea or glass of vino at the end of the afternoon. Ask for a room overlooking the courtyard from floor 3 and above. Another tip get your tickets on line for Vatican, Colosseum etc the queues are long. You can walk to the Vatican but it is about an hour and don't rely on taxis they can be in short supply early in the morning. We ended up hitchhiking and only in Rome we got a lift straight away! Go for dinner over the bridge or at one of the Piazzas and saunter back through Campo Fiori, lovely. For a trendy people spotting night out go to Gusto, expensive but it has a lovely cooking shop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for a Family”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelNJ15
Reviews.Content: What a treasure. This perfectly located hotel is in the heart of ancient Rome, steps away from the Campo di Fiori. The staff was informative and very helpful. We travelled with our two small children and got two rooms that connected through a private vestibule-- perfect. Our room had a small terrace where we could look out and drink wine. Even the showers were great. A huge breakfast buffet is included. The prices in season are high,, but worth it. It could not have been a better choice for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: JBDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 4 nights from June 14, 2007. First of all, the location is great. It's right next to the Ponte Sisto bridge so you are a two minute walk to the Trastevere area. This is a lively, fun area with lots happening, great bars, trattorias, street markets and entertainment in the evening. We walked into this area each evening and had 4 great meals - the Alle Fratte di Trastevere on Via delle Fratte di Trastevere was a favourite - excellent food and good value too. The square next to the church of Santa Maria in Trastevere has really nice bars for an early evening drink. We felt very safe and the area had a great atmosphere. We received a warm and friendly welcome from the front of house staff (all of the staff we encountered spoke very good english). Our room was on the 4th floor and was a decent size with a good bathroom (bath & shower) and overlooked the private gardens at the back of the hotel. It had French windows that opened up onto a mini balcony which caught the evening sun. A complimentary basket of fruit was most welcome and the mini-bar was the most reasonably priced bar we have EVER come across, how nice to feel you're not getting ripped off for a bottle of beer. As we said before, the location is just great. A 20 minute walk up river to the Vatican, a 15 min walk to the Colosseum and Forum and about half an hour stroll to the Trevi fountain. We got the Metro twice but only because we were a bit hot! Breakfasts are excellent. Hot and cold food available in the beautiful courtyard, bread, fruit, yoghurts, pastries, eggs, sausages and excellent coffee. Booking a taxi via the hotel to transfer to and from the airport (65 euros there and 50 back) is well worth considering as the driver will take you to the door whereas it's a bit of a trek from the station or Metro otherwise. The downside (yes, there is one) is the cost. The hotel is not cheap BUT you are paying for the location and it's second to none in my opinion. We are definitely going back. ____________________________________________________________________________________ Sucker-punch spam with award-winning protection. Try the free Yahoo! Mail Beta. Reviews.Title: “AC would have been great...”
Reviews.Author: RTSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat disappointed with our stay at Ponte Sisto. We had a small but nice room that opened onto its own terrace. On the downside, the room was hot and stuffy. When we asked about the air conditioning, we were told that it was off for the entire building. When we asked if it could be turned on, we were told that the staff asked the manager to turn it on every day to no avail. When pressed further, the staff indicated that there were laws against turning on the AC until a certain date. I do not know if this is true, but you would expect better for $250 Euros per night. I was also disappointed in the large amount of grafitti near and on the hotel. In addition, the hotel was not close to public transit. It was close to the neighborhood of Trastevere, which has a great night scene. Lastly, I must say that we were disappointed in the coffee. We assumed that coffee would be great anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jbullock47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most expensive (260 Euro) of all the places that we stayed in our 2-week vacation in Italy. Am I ever glad we spent the money! It is a quiet, calm, cool oasis in the center of noisy, bustling Rome. When your nerves are jangled from dodging the traffic and the other tourists or you're just overwhelmed by so much fantastic art and too much history, you can retreat to Ponte Sisto's courtyard and have a drink. Or just sit and read for a while. The room was not huge, but it was certainly adequate and it was very nicely appointed and very quiet. The buffet breakfast was terrific -- plenty of fruit, cereal and lots of other goodies as well as (my favorite) a bottomless pot of coffee. I'll definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wizbang1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for six nights during our holiday to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived everyone was so helpful. Our room overlooked the inner courtyard, was spacious and quiet with a large bathroom. The breakfasts were delicious. This hotel is so central that we walked everywhere apart from a taxi for our early morning start to the Vatican Museum tour. We walked over the bridge to Trastavere for dinner most nights followed by coffee and grappa in the Campo dei Fiori. The icing on the cake was the car arranged to take us to the airport for our journey home. A well organised hotel with excellent staff and facilities in a beautiful city - thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tip-ses
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Great location, helpful staff, yummy breakfast. I emailed in advance asking them to book reservations at a few restaurants and they took care of it all. We requested non-smoking rooms and had no problem with this. The staff was very responsive to emails sent to them in English.

Reviews.Title: “At least the location worked well....”
Reviews.Author: Pickytraveler2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 5 days with immediate and extended family (a total of 10) for our first trip to Rome. The hotel has rooms that can adjoin or share a common hallway for families. They call these rooms, "junior suites", but these are not the same as American suites. This arrangement worked ok if all you want to use the room for is sleeping. It was really too small for anything else, even for a dresser to unload a suitcase...we just lived out of our luggage. The bathroom was nicely done in marble -- everywhere! -- but the shower was so small you could barely fit through the door. Our rooms did have nice terraces with rooftop views, although we could not use them with the rain. As with most hotel website photos, these do not represent the typical room. Candid photos by other travelers are more accurate. The hotel was clean and neat, furnished with dark wood and light pastels and always with fresh flowers - a nice touch. The front desk staff was competent and helpful and there was always someone on duty that spoke English, which helped our limited Italian. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. We were there for 5 days and did not tire of it. The hotel does not have a restaurant, which we found a bit inconvenient. The front desk will tell you that you can ask for simple amenities...like hot water to make a cup of tea, but we found that the attendant in the bar was quite rude and annoyed by our requests for a pot of hot water. After two such attempts, we gave up trying. The highlight of the hotel is the central courtyard...truly an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Rome. Unfortunately, it rained or was cool for 4 of the 5 days we were there and the courtyard was not in use. The hotel made little effort to utilize it if there was hint of rain. There is a small market/grocery just a few doors down. We booked the hotel based a combination of TripAdvisor reviews, location and direct e-mail communications with the hotel. The location worked out well. It was centrally located and allowed us to walk many places in central Rome. It was quiet at night, although one of our party could hear noise from the bar/street below. Overall, we felt the hotel was too expensive for what it provided -- basically a sleeping room and breakfast. We will try a different hotel on our second trip to Rome before going back to the Ponte Sisto.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central”
Reviews.Author: DoublinPair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed. Just 10 to 15 minutes from the Vatican, a short stroll to the Trastevere, ten minutes from Piazza Navona, Pantheon and Trevi etc. Welcoming staff. Room was on the small side but had a terrace which helped. Everything you needed was there but somehow there was little wow factor. This is a tourist hotel and ideal for what it does. Remember it is breakfast only. This is very pleasant when served in the courtyard and is a well stocked buffet. It was no drawback not having a restaurant. Osteria Ponte Sisto , which was recommended by the concierge, is just across the bridge and is very good value. Try the tripe Roman style. And it's just three minutes stagger away. Trastevere is full of restaurants. Try Ristorante Galeassi in the piazza of Santa Maria in Trastevere (5 minutes walk). Good food and excellent service. Across the way is Ristoranti Sabatini where the food is very good but the staff treat tourists like something they found on the sole of their shoe. Not a place to go which is a pity because the food is genuinely good if pricier than Galeassi. This hotel is an ideal spot for a three to five day visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a great location, incredible view”
Reviews.Author: kraworld
Reviews.Content: Great for what i paid. really good breakfast - eggs, variety of meats,pastries, cereals, etc. helpful front desk staff. seemed a bit brusque at first, but i think that is just rome. try to speak some italian - it helps. very nice room but the view (windows on two sides) was wonderful! Beautiful terrace up top and equally lovely outside courtyard on the main floor. the location is very central but out of the way of tourists. it is along the tiber, so the walkway along there is a really good way to avoid getting lost in the maze of streets in the old part of rome, which is easy to do. the vatican was about a 25 minute walk and all the other sites were even closer. i would not hesitate to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CiaoMilano
Reviews.Content: I usually avoid hotels with conference room facilities but this hotel is quite intimate in style and has a most beautiful courtyard where guests can relax. Towards the rear of the hotel there is a large terrace hidden away where one can catch a vista of Roma rooftops and beyond – truly lovely. The hotel bedrooms while small and very plain are of a very good standard with luxury bathrooms. Rooms with windows over the lane of the hotel entrance can be a smidgen noisy in the evenings. For me though, there was nothing more exciting than throwing open the shutters to the sounds and sights of Roma in the cobbled lane below. Mind you, if you just have to have peace and quiet – the rooms at the rear of the hotel would suit and one of the ones we stayed in also had a lovely vista. As others have commented, the hotel is well located for a number of the important tourist sites. The friendly staff were always helpful and at breakfast there was plenty to eat - hot or cold. My only comment …… the staff usually say ‘Good Morning’ rather than ‘Buongiorno’. When I said 'Buongiorno' to one very nice staff member he clapped his hands with glee and said “brava!!’ as if I had achieved the impossible over the guests he usually deals with. So, for me, it would be great to hear ‘Buongiorno’ from the staff - before, of course - they help me out by speaking anything else to me in English! Enjoy your stay at this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: IanP_Ely
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 3 nights last week and had a wonderful time. The location is second to none - it's close to many main attractions (we liked sitting in the piazza's best) but situated down a pleasant side street you feel like you are returning to a calm oasis at the end of a long days site-seeing. The hotel staff were all polite and/or attentive. My Italian is very limited, but everyone on the reception desk spoke excellent English which helps considerably. The hotel does not have a restaurant for lunches or evening meals which is not a problem at all - there is such a huge choice of excellect trattorias and bars in the vicinity. Breakfasts were a real treat, sitting out in the courtyard over your first coffee of the day choosing from a wide variety of fruit, pastries, cold meats, cheeses, and also eggs, bacon and sausages for the brave hearted. We had a room at the back of the hotel which overlooked some gardens and had a view. Pretty quiet there too. Rooms were spotless. While we were there there were quite a few Italian business people staying which shows its not your typical "chain" serving tourists only. If the locals use it you know it's good! Would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to all - I'm going back as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for my first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: jwhflorida
Reviews.Content: Ponte Sisto Hotel is centrally located to most of the major attractions in Rome. From the bridge with the same name, you can see the dome on St. Peter's Basilica, i.e., a short walk to the Vatican. The single person room I stayed in was more than adequate. The window in the room openned to the enterior courtyard. I visited in late April so the weather was very comfortable. I'm not sure if the room even had an air conditioner, but for my stay it was not needed. You might ask them if your sensitive to temperature/humidity. Breakfast at the hotel was enjoyeable with plenty of variety to choose from. I was never partial to runny scrambled eggs and soft cooked bacon, but this seems to be the norm in resturants from Asia to Europe. They had enough of a selection that there was plenty of others things to eat. The staff was pretty helpful through-out my stay. If I was planning to revisit Rome I would not yesitate to stay at the Ponte Sisto Hotel. The exterior is a little intimatating, but don't be but off by that. Once inside the hotel proper it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: ekerr19
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! We booked three rooms for a pre-cruise stay and were delighted with the property and the staff. It is in close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do - also the staff could not do enough for us. We really wanted to avoid a "chain" hotel experience and this did not disappoint. The bathrooms in all three rooms were so gorgeous - we also loved that our rooms had balconies overlooking the courtyard. The breakfast is amazing and if you cross the river, dinner in Trastevere is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ETVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 5 nights during Spring Break and, we were very pleased. The hotel is conveniently located to many of the top tourist sites....we walked everywhere. It's just around the corner from Campo de Fiori....lots of restaurants to choose from. There is also a grocery store a few doors down....great for picking up waters/soda and snacks. The staff we're extremely helpful and friendly -- they upgraded our room to a mini-suite...it was great because my son had his own room. As mentioned in previous reviews, the rooms are small.....but, very clean. Also, the breakfast was generally good with a nice variety....and, cappucinos were included...nice touch. Overall, would highly recommend the Ponte Sisto!

Reviews.Title: “very happy here”
Reviews.Author: park60
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Ponte Sisto. Our room (#113) and bathroom were large, clean and well maintained. The hotel is in a good central location, a 4-5 minute walk from Campo di Fiori. We walked everywhere, even to the Vatican. We had a large jacuzzi tub without a traditional shower. If this is important to you, please ask. The hotel staff made excellent recommendations for restaurants and took care of reservations for us as needed. There was always someone on duty who spoke fluent English. The breakfast buffet was the best we experienced while in Italy. We would definitely stay here again. Note: We stayed on the street side, and these rooms are noisy at night. What looks like a quiet side street during the day becomes a major pedestrian thoroughfare for the late night party crowd. And it is amazing how late they party! I am a light sleeper, and next time I would request a room facing the lovely, quiet garden courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed, the staff is very helpful, and the location is great. We stayed for one week and could not have been more satisfied. We generally stay in 5 star hotels, but I could not find one in Rome that would acommodate our family with adjoining rooms during the week of our trip. The Hotel Ponte Sisto has two rooms on the fifth floor to which access can be limited, effectively becoming a two bedroom, two bath suite (at a very competitive rate). The location allows for easy walks to the Forum, the Pantheon, and most of the "must see" attractions in Rome. It is also right across the Tiber River (via a short pedestrian bridge) from the Trastevere neighborhood, which provides access to numerous excellent local restaurants. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Grzeg0rz
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights with my partner in March 2007. Overall the hotel made a very good impression. In my opinion better choice for couples rather then families. I believe the strongest point is a very good location a bit outside of the busiest and most touristy districts of the city - still with short walking distance from most of the attractions. Also you will find many good restaurants around the place - especially when you cross the bridge (ask for advise at the reception if you do not have a good tourist guide book). On the pluses side I would put also a very good quality of service and overall atmosphere of truly Italian venue - you will not feel there like being in one of those international network hotels. Rooms decorated nicely with good quality materials but without overwhelming "luxury" and cheap looking golden fitting. On the opportunity side I would mention lack of hotel restaurant and breakfast, which is good but nothing really special. When mentioning breakfast - you should not miss having one on the fantastic backyard (on a worm day of course). Price was from my perspective a bit high but I believe that's what you should accept going to Rome. Still for 3 days I could afford it and I believe at the end of the day it was worthwhile. I do recommend it! Grzegorz, Warsaw - Poland.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great for a family, wish I was there now”
Reviews.Author: JM_Belfast
Reviews.Content: I selected Hotel Ponte Sisto based on previous reviews and was extremely happy with the choice. I think it would be hard to find a better location, so central for easy access to the many sites of Rome (many within walking distance) and a couple of minutes stumbling distance to excellent restaurants in Trastevere. Another reason for selecting the hotel- I wanted adjoining rooms for two children that are now too big to share 1 family room. The layout at Ponte Sisto was perfect, the 2 rooms were on a corner and completely separate- with an extra door in the main corridor being closed to create a common joining area (a bit like a porch) for the 2 separate rooms. If felt more spacious and more of your own space than standard interconnecting rooms. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, staff were professional and quite friendly. I thought breakfast was generally very good. As you might expect, it was more European than hotels in the US/ UK/ Ireland but did do a small selection of bacon/ sausages/ scrambled eggs as well as cold meats, cereals, fruit, breads, pastries, biscuits etc. Breakfast staff were friendly and helpful, although it was a bit too busy with less choice on 1 of the 3 mornings. But normally they kept replenishing right up to the closing time (10.00). I had a great time here, but I did get a good discounted rate- I imagine I would probaly be less satisfied if I had paid the full rack rate (especially when paying for 2 rooms!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarinaMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for three nights right before Christmas and had a great time there. It is a beautiful hotel right across the bridge from Trastevere and close to Campo di Fiori, which is a lively area with lots of shopping, restaurants, and gelaterias. We had three rooms, all a bit different but all with beautiful bathrooms. We booked through reservationitaly and got a great rate for such a nice hotel. It was too cold to eat on the beautiful patio, but I could see that it would be a lovely experience when the weather is warmer. The breakfast was the best we had during our stay in Italy with a large variety of fresh fruit, pastries, bread and rolls, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, hot and cold meats, cheese, yogurt, cereal, and more. The coffee and the capuccinos were outstanding. The room's minibar prices were reasonable compared to the others we'd seen. The gelateria right across the street from the hotel is excellent, and there is a grocery store a few doors away where you can buy inexpensive bottled water, etc. The staff was very helpful when we needed directions and public transit info for our sightseeing. I recommend having the front desk staff arrange a car for you if you need to get to or from the airport. It's more comfortable than a taxi and well worth 50 euros. I highly recommend this hotel and if I'm lucky enough to return to Rome, I will definitely stay at the Hotel Ponte Sisto again.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: texanaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for a couple of days on our way home from Rapallo. This is a lovely hotel in a great location by the river and it is walking distance to many sights. Apparently the rooms can vary, but ours was absolutely stunning. It had a balcony from which we could see St. Peter's dome across the rooftops. The room was compact, but furnished nicely with every amenity and the bathroom was gorgeous and had a spa bath with great toiletries. We think they may have upgraded us without mentioning it as we paid the normal room rate. Continental breakfast is served in the most beautiful courtyard and the service was wonderful throughout our (too) short stay. They were especially helpful with shopping hints and directons. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fl.klaus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just back from a 4 nights stay in Rome. We really enjoed our holiday, because of good weather, good food, good wine and excellent hotel. We stayed at Hotel Ponte Sisto and although we choose it after to read nice reviews, it was better than our expectatives. The location is perfect. In Campo De Fiori, between Trastevere and Piazza Navona. A special mention for the courtyard. We got a room with a balcony over the courtyard, and we loved it. We did not asked for a room with a balcony, so it was a " surpise " The staff could not be more friendly, suggesting us restaurants and allowing us an early check in ( at 9:30 ) I got the price of Euro 215,00 booking through reservationitaly. I will surely reserve Hotel Ponte Sisto for my next trip to Rome. Klaus

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJOS
Reviews.Content: Hote - Ponte Sisto, Rome Stay - Oct 06 Reviewer: AJOS Ireland We stayed in this lovely hotel for three nights in October. We flew into rome and got the train into termini central for 11 euro each and got a taxi to hotel which cost 10euro. We had room 110. A lovely room with a huge jucazzi bath ( no shower ) and a lovely terrace which was not overlooked. This hotel is located on a quiet side street but is in a perfect location to explore Rome on foot. (Bring good walking shoes for the cobbled streets). We were only 5 minutes to Campo Di Flori and another 5 ins to Piazza Navona which is a great place to eat at night. The Piazza Navona is alive with street traders and artists and all the restaurants around the square are lovely and good value. The hotel is central and you can easily walk to the Vatican, (about 20 mins ) and the same to the Colessum, and trevi fountain and spanish steps. Breakfast was lovely, fresh fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, eggs. Typical tasty european breakfast. The bar in the hotel is small and very quiet. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Will definatley stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: missouritourist
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Ponte Sisto was easily one of the best decisions we made during our recent trip to Italy. The location of the hotel enabled us to walk to any of the sites we hoped to see. The staff was wonderful from booking online, answering questions prior to arrival and informing us of many additional places to see once we arrived. They even helped us find a private guide of the Vatican better than any we could have wanted. If you stay here, try to get room 601 - only room on the floor, private balcony, and an amazing view of St. Peter's. We also went to Tuscany and Venice and there was no comparison for this hotel. Josh Tennison

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MBCon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in ideal location (along the Tiber River and across Ponte Sisto (bridge of same name) from exciting Trestevere neighborhood. We had Room 601 (which is only room on 6th floor). Room was smallest but bathroom was marble and large. Best of all, room has 2 balconies (from one you can see St. Peter's dome). Staff was basically friendly and help. Free breakfast was adequate (at best) but no capaccino offered so we needed to get some across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable view”
Reviews.Author: flosser
Reviews.Content: Of the four hotels we tried this visit...Ponte Sisto was the most memorable. The bathrooms were all sienna marble, immaculately clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and the fabrics were crisp, clean and new. The breakfast included was the most comprehensive with the freshest selection of fruits and breads and egg options. The deck view was spectacular with olive, lemon and lime tree plantings. We loved the location for exploring Campo di fiore and Trastevere.Maybe a fifteen minute walk to the Pantheon. We payed less at this hotel than the others and had more friendly service. I would highly recommend it. .

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: beechmk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for six nights in mid-September, 2006. Quite simply, it couldn't have been any better. The front desk staff was always helpful with directions, and suggested a car for our return to the airport because of a cab strike. The open-air garden is a delightful respite from the frenetic pace of Roman traffic. It is within walking distance of most major attractions, or easy public transportation access. Immediately across the bridge (the Ponte Sisto from which the hotel takes its name) is Trastevere which still has real, not trendy, restaurants, which serve delicious pasta. The hotel is smallish, and attracts a polyglot clientele, not just Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: Just got back after 4 days in Rome staying at the Ponte Sisto. All the praise that has been heaped on this hotel in previous reviews is spot on. Not only is the hotel itself a gem, its location is perfect with all the major sites within reasonable walking distance. Would definately stay there again and will strongly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but....”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: My family and I had 3 rooms in this hotel. Unfortunately, 2 of the rooms we were initially assigned to had non functioning A/C . It took several calls and trips to reception to get the situation rectified which was a bit irritating as we were eager to go out and explore. The hotel itself is lovely. Beautiful courtyard where breakfast is served. The standard rooms are very small, however, the bathrooms were a good size, modern and clean. Breakfast and service was OK. Would probably stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slowride
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and were not disappointed. The hotel itself is located on a narrow street close to the TIber. It is immaculate and very nicely decorated in a colorful, Mediterranian style. There is a nice courtyard, but no pool. The staff was very helpful and friendly, too. What's best about the hotel is its location- about equidistant from all of the major sites in Rome. Also close to the Campo di Fiori. Don't miss walking to Trastevere (across the river) for dinner- lively outdoor scene (at least in the summer, when we were there) with more locals and generally better food. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raichino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation to Roma & Firenze. In Rome we stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 4 nights. We loved our room. We were given room #421 which had a great view. Upon our arrival they gave us a bottle of complimentary champagne. We had a king sized bed (though it was hard ... our only complaint). I was expecting a small room after reading about European hotels but we thought the room was big. There was lots of closet space. The bathroom was huge. There was a big bathtub & a regular shower head. It was also very clean which is important to me. The staff was friendly. Another great appeal for this hotel is it's location. We walked everywhere from the hotel. It seemed like we walked for miles & miles everyday but we just took breaks & saw all of Rome on foot. Just wandering around the city you find many amazing sites & beautiful views. The hotel is right by the Ponte Sisto bridge over the Tiber River so it was easy for us to find our way back. We would go out during the day & come back for a little rest before going back out in the evening. There's a market to the left of the hotel that makes it convenient to buy water at the beginning of your day. Around the corner to the left is Campo di Fiore with lots of restaurants to choose from. We loved the Heartbreak restaurant's spaghetti bolognese. Also, across the Ponte Sisto Bridge is the Travestere area. We enjoyed roaming the many alley ways & finding good places to eat. We highly recommend the Ponte Sisto & would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: spencal
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children stayed here two nights in mid July, 2006. We had requested 2 non-smoking, adjoining rooms. We had been told at the time the reservation was made that in order to receive our requested rooms, one room would have to be booked at a slightly higher rate (just 30 Eur per night more for one of the rooms) as the cheaper rate was a run of the house rate. We indeed got the rooms we had requested which made the extra 30 per night well worth it. The rooms were a nice size, the bathrooms were very large. They provided two sponges per room for bathing purposes (wonderful for those of us who are accustomed to using a wash cloth!) The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. There was a bit of noise from the street below at night, but it really didn't interfere much with our sleep. The breakfast was fine. It was included in the price of the room. There wasn't alot that my children would eat, however they did have Nutela, which my kids love. As with other reviews, the staff is not overly friendly, a bit reserved I would say. They weren't unfriendly, just not real outgoing. When presented with a question or need for service, they were always helpful. The location was good. As there was a taxi strike during our stay, we walked almost everywhere we went. The hotel arranged our transportation to and from the airport. There is a great gelato store across the street from the hotel and a nice little grocery next door. We highly recommend the Ponte Sisto Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Spide
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome on July 10th 2006. We stayed at the Ponte Sisto and had our wedding reception with 30 guests in the beautiful hotel garden. Staff were all so helpful not only in the months leading up to our wedding but also during our stay. The garden was so beautifully decorated and the food of which there was so much (6 courses) was fantastic. It was a really wonderful experience and we would highly recommend the hotel to anyone considering a visit to Rome. All rooms are beautiful, breakfast is great and so is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful respite in hot, busy Roma”
Reviews.Author: Barb60
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in two rooms and found the Ponte Sisto to be a quiet, cool respite after long days of sightseeing in hot, crowded Rome (which we loved!) Over the course of our trip, we stayed in five different hotels in Germany, Italy, and France and the Ponte Sisto was the nicest by far. Yes, the rooms were smallish and the beds were hard, but it was immaculately clean, the breakfasts were plentiful, and the air conditioning was a treat. Also, contrary to some other postings, we found the desk staff to be very helpful. They all spoke English, which was great because my Italian is awful, and were happy to answer our questions. The restaurant recommended by the woman at the desk when we arrived was wonderful. All in all, the Hotel Ponte Sisto gets a thumbs up from our family!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not sure we share the raves about the rooms...”
Reviews.Author: CAishome
Reviews.Content: Family of four just returned from trip to Italy and Spain. Stayed 4 nights at Ponte Sisto, and while I agree that the location is a good one in terms of its proximity to points of interest, I would not say that the rooms were excellent by any means, at least not the two that we were given. My husband's and my room was smallish with one small window and a small bathroom. Beds and pillows very hard (but true in other locations in Italy). Our daughters (teenagers) had slightly better room as it had double windows out onto the inner courtyard and was a bit more charming. Front desk staff was brusque and not very interested in assisting us with inquiries--luckily we did not need them for much. Also, the courtyard was 'closed for remodeling' during our stay (never saw any work going on, though), and so we were relegated to eat breakfast in the rather drab inner breakfast room. Had it not been included in our daily rate, I would have preferred to go over to the Campo di' Fiori (short 5 minute walk) for a roll and cafe anyway. I think next time we'll splurge on a slightly more historic center location and hotel. We all loved Rome, the heat notwithstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto for five nights in late May/early June and found that it met or exceeded all of our needs. The location can’t be beat – we walked everywhere, and the farthest attraction was probably no more than a 20-minute walk from the hotel. Don’t be alarmed that you’re in a small alley upon arrival at the hotel – it seemed like a safe, well-populated area even at night (in fact, the police station is about a block up the alley). The area is charming and scenic, and once you’re acclimated it’s easy to find your way back to the hotel from wherever you might be. There are so many options for dinner within a very short walk – Piazza Navona was our favorite area, also Campo dei Fiori and you need only cross the Ponte Sisto bridge to arrive in Trastevere. The Pantheon is also very close by. The hotel itself is quiet, very clean, and elegant – a great place to return to after a long day of sightseeing. The front desk staff are reserved but helpful, and we were easily able to leave our luggage with them upon arrival while we went out to lunch until our room was ready. Breakfast is served in the beautiful, peaceful courtyard. Filled with flowers, palm trees, a fountain, and a view of the blue sky above, it’s most wonderful way to start your day. Breakfast is plentiful and done very nicely, with whole fruit and little packets of crackers/cookies that we were able to take with us in our backpack for a snack later in the day. All of the hotel’s common areas (lobby, bar, main level restrooms) are clean and very nicely appointed. Our room was very spacious (especially by European standards) in a comfortable L-shape, with three large windows. The room was quiet, impeccably clean and not too hot or cold. The bed was on the hard side but we traveled to three Italian cities on this trip and found that to be true in every hotel. The bathroom was very, very nice – all marble, with a double sink, nice lighting and a whirlpool tub. The only anomaly was that there was no real shower! The whirlpool tub had a hand-held sprayer/shower attachment, but there was no way to hang or mount it on the wall. We had to get creative -- each morning, one of us would hold the showerhead, standing on a stool, while the other showered (but obviously this wouldn’t be ideal if privacy were an issue)! Also, without a shower curtain or doors, there is no way to avoid getting a lot of water on the bathroom floor. We asked for extra towels for the floor and received them no problem every day. For us, the shower quirk didn’t take away from our overall 100% satisfaction with the room and the hotel in general. The Ponte Sisto is a fantastic place to stay – you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommend the Ponte Sisto!”
Reviews.Author: nparmelee
Reviews.Content: We were in room 207, mini suite, for three nights and it was perfect for our stay in Rome. Very quiet room that we could make very dark which helped us get over our jet lag. Staff was excellent and very responsive to all emails we sent them. Location was great for walking to all the sites, 20 minutes or less to just about everything. We stopped taking our maps and just wandered in the general direction we wanted to go and found some amazing sites and restaurants this way. Hotel breakfast was also very good and gave us a good start to our day. We will go back to Rome and back to the Ponte Sisto for our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: fantastic in every way. great location. great staff. great room/bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice”
Reviews.Author: khkh
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a very convenient location. The beds were as hard as the floors, however. But, the AC was working. We had #312 which was oversized and a had a huge bathroom. The linens were great! The breakfast was wonderful - the chocolate filled croissants were too yummy! The courtyard is so pretty and calm and tranquil. I would highly recommend this hotel. We were 3 minutes from Campo di'Fiore and 10 from Piazza Navonna. The prettiest, in my opinion, church in Rome is 30 feet to the right of the hotel's front door. It's open in late afternoon. There is a grocery store 30 feet to the left of the front door! The staff was helpful without being overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay : ideally located, quiet, clean, great breakfast......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent our 20th wedding anniversary there. Found the hotel after researching the internet and it fulfilled all of our expectations. Service was professional, correct and friendly. Had a standard double room, with a small terrace which was perfect to relax a little bit between day and evening city visits. Room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is perfectly located, you have all famous visiting places within 30 minutes walking distance. The buffet breakfast was very good, a wide variety of choices and the quality of the food impeccable. Having breakfast in the courtyard (when wheather permits) was already a perfect start of the day. The ladies servicing the guests were efficient and very friendly. In summary, if you're looking for a hotel that combines all typical requirements, picking this hotel is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: ezra303
Reviews.Content: After reading uniformly positive reviews about this hotel, I booked it for a stay from March 4-11, 2006. What a great hotel!. Lovely decor, great location, wonderful breakfast. No negatives of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 306 from february 19 to february 25, 2006. Nice, clean and quiet room with afternoon sun. The daytime reception staff was very effective and helpfull. All my questions were handled quickly and professionally. Italian hardware Of the two phones at the bed, only one worked. No problem. The automatic wakeup on the working phone did not work. The TV wake-up system did work though (alkthough the clock was 20 minutes off), so I mostly called the reception to obtain my morning call. One morning I got the wakeup call at 6:30 instead of 7:30 (that took a bit to overcome). All wakeup calls come twice - with a three minute interval (untill you are accustomed to that, it's really convenient to have a phone in the bathroom too). Bathroom Clean. Shower a bit on the small side for my taste, and the "fixed" shower head is not my style. I prefer a showerhead with a hose, that you can move around your body. Internet Hotel advertises Internet in the room, but it's old dial-up internet via the hotel switchboard. Didn't try it. Internet in the bar was a computer, that could be rented. Didn't use it. There's no way to connect your own computer to a low-cost or high-speed internet (Neither ADSL nor WLAN). Did try Mondadori near the Trevi Fountain. Their internet was down, when I was there. Found a small café (Good Caffé in via Dorothea, not far from the hotel), where you could get a coffee, beer or some wine, and a snack or two - or a meal (noon and evening) - and free WLAN access at the same time. It worked. It was a nice place with a rare atmosphere and the young people running the place were nice and very polite. Breakfeast restaurant Good. Quiet, polite and effective with a wide range of different choices for most tastes. Was included in my price. Special requests by guests seemed to be handled promptly. The hotel has no dinner restaurant. Bar was not visited. Rome had too many interesting places to visit. Distance to Forum Romanum approx. 1000 meters. To Vatican approx. 1200 meters (Via Giulia starts near the hotel) on foot. Perfect location to reach most sights inside the old city walls on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fabulous location, next to the river and convenient to many attractions. The staff was fabulous -- extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. We brought our two toddlers as well, and the suite was perfect for that. There's a cute garden in the center as well, which we would have loved to just sit in, except the weather didn't cooperate.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Rome 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, my son, and I stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto over Christmas. Our stay was outstanding! The hotel and its staff were excellent. They helped us in many ways especially finding restuarants which were open on Christmas day. We had a wonderful time in Rome! I would highly recommend visitng Rome and this hotel anytime! We are planning on returning in 2007. We have fallen in love with Italy and we hope to return many, many times!! Everything in Italy was great- the people, the food, the accommodations, the sites, everything!! Hotel Ponte Sisto is in a great location and was outstanding. I loved the bathroom!! Very clean environment and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome in September 2005 and we stayed in the Hotel Ponte Sisto along with our wedding guests for 4 nights, and we all had a truly excellent time. We also had our wedding reception there and it was beautiful to say the least. The food was magnificent along with the service and they pulled out all the stops for us. The hotel is situated down an ally way but do not be put of by this, as there is a lot of small ally ways in Rome, and anyway a police station is 50 meters away from the hotel door. The location is very central and everyting is within walking distance. The inside of the hotel was very clean along with the bedrooms. We stayed in the honeymoon suite for the 4 nights and got the pleasure of a large balcony over looking the Vatican. The staff in the hotel were a delight and did everything possible to make our stay very comfortable and one to remember. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome and I will definitely be going back to it.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ponte Sisto in October 2005. The hotel was very clean. The bathroom was spotless. We were in a suite that had a huge terrace. It must be bigger than the room itself. My husband was a bit weary at first because the hotel entrance was in an alley. It turned out Rome have many allies and this is normal. The hotel also made arrangement for a car to pick us up from the airport and the driver was there when we picked up our luggages. The room included breakfast which was a plus with us. The coffee was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jjfrenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at the Hotel Ponte Sisto and were very happy with our room. The hotel was clean and quiet. Our room was just average size, but furnished tastefully and quite comfortable. The bathroom was very big and clean with nice green marble and crisp white fixtures. The courtyard was a great place to sit and rest after a busy day of touring. Breakfast was included for us and the selection of food was impressive: fresh fruit, cereals, yougurt, breads, cheeses, meats, pastries........and very good coffee! I loved the location. Out front is a quiet street that resembles an alley in the U.S. I liked that it felt quaint and that there were little shops along the street. Each night after the rest of our group turned in, my husband and I would walk for about 5 or 10 minutes to different restaurants where we could sit outside and have a glass of wine, usually in front of one of the many fountains in Rome. Even though we were out until midnight many nights, there were lots of other people out too and we felt very safe. I must admit that our 8 night stay was split between two hotels and the Ponte Sisto was the hands down winner. Both hotels were considered three star and cost within $10 of each other, but the Ponte Sisto seemed like a five star compared to the other! I think the Ponte Sisto is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel017
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Hotel Ponte Sisto and loved the location. The rooms were a bit small, but the bathroom is large and very nice. We loved Rome!!! A couple of the restaurants within walking distance we enjoyed were Fabrizio's and Sabatini's. Would stay again at The Hotel Ponte Sisto, hope to be back in Rome again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mtruelove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Rome last Jan 29, 2005. Our entire wedding party stayed at hotel Ponte Sisto and we all LOVED it. We were a bit weary as we booked sight unseen....most of our decision making was based from this sight and what others had to say about the hotel. I can't emphasize enough how fantastic the hotel is...the rooms, the breakfast, the location and of course the fantastic service!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed if you book this hotel. I'm American and my husband is English and the standards set at this hotel are tops. We will definately go back.....also we had kids in our party and they were welcome and well taken care of!!!!

Reviews.Title: “****Plus for Hotel Ponte Sisto”
Reviews.Author: Crumlin
Reviews.Content: We (husband & I) stayed at the Ponte Sisto from September 28 to October 2. The room (oversized and then some...Room 423) was more than we had expected. Very large private terrace, beautiful marble bathroom with jacuzzi tub/shower...slight disappointment...bed was two twins pushed together. Spotlessly CLEAN! and I mean clean...I am a fanatic about this. Coffee was great...best in Italy that I had, buffet breakfast very good....especially nice on the outside terrace, weather permitting. Staff spoke and understood English, cheerful, helpful with mapping out directions, arranged for private car to take us to airport (50 Euro, well worth it) Bar staff (Anna was a pleasant to chat with) very nice. Staying here made loving ROMA even more. We lucked out with picture perfect weather. Hope this review helps. Please also see my review of the Grand Hotel De La Ville we stayed at in Sorrento.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but lacking character”
Reviews.Author: rhetorica
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Ponte Sisto in July with my 16-year-old son. The location was great for walking to many sights, and the coffee, as noted by previous posters, was delicious. While the garden was truly lovely, the rooms were well appointed and the staff was pleasant, somehow this hotel lacked charm and personality.... We stayed for three nights then went to Pompeii and Capri (stayed at Villa Brunella--a little pricey but worth it ) and returned for one night before our flight back to NY. We stayed in a suite the first three nights, but actually preferred the regular twin room we were in on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: peggiLivermore_CA
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from THE BEST OF ITALY tour with Globus/Brendan. This was my favorite hotel of of the eight that we stayed at. It was very clean and had a lovely marble bathroom with a nice tub/shower and two sinks. The courtyard is shaded with nice large umbrellas. It's near many places of interest. The breakfast in their courtyard was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: lizalev
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a "suite" with my daughter--room #401--with a small bedroom, 2 twins, a small living area, and a large bathroom with tub. The main feature is the HUGE terrace. Expensive at 340 euros, but worth the terrace. I would highly recommend for anyone who has kids who need to run around. Very nice, clean, modern hotel. No wireless internet, but pay service in one of the lobbies. Service was mixed. One very unfriendly girl at the lobby desk. Location is excellent for Trastevere and all tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations... Average Service from Staff”
Reviews.Author: Andreozzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for four days in August. We have never traveled to Europe before so we did not quite know what to expect. Our only real reference point would be the cash outlay per night and the service we would have expected in an American resort or hotel. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. The air conditioning in the room worked well. The grounds of the hotel were impeccable and the breakfast was good enough that we ate it everyday -- it was an Italian breakfast. We did have a few disappointments though mainly based on services provided by the staff. The first day no one cleaned our room and on the second day once again our room was not cleaned nor was a change of towels provided. We called three times and finally someone was sent to our room to clean it up. The remaining days we always returned to our room and found it cleaned up. The second item, is that there is no "real" consiguerre, you will be dependant on the staff at the reception desk. They unfortunately provided us with tons of misinformation. We would typically expect better of a hotel with average prices of $180.00 per night. Last item, when we booked they indicated that they had high speed Internet access in the rooms. This was not the case. None of the challenges really ruined our stay in Rome and for all we know this could have been a much worse scenario at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SusieG
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ponte Sisto on the recommendations in TripAdvisor reviews and discovered a gem of a hotel; it was a first visit to Rome for my daughter and me - four days in the heat of July - and a delight to return to sit and have a drink in the cool, peaceful courtyard! Don't be put off by the tiny entrance down the dark alleyway! The hotel has all 'mod cons', immaculate marble bathrooms, excellent air-con, brand-new furnishings etc, but in beautifully renovated old buildings that really make you appreciate you are in Italy, with that lovely courtyard with its palm trees and masses of flowers, and a huge roof-top sun terrace with stunning views over Rome (though no other guests seemed to know that was there!). It's well placed for walking to many of the main tourist attractions - and felt very safe for two women walking home at night, which was important to us. We loved the 20 minute walk along the Via Guilia to the Vatican. It was only 5 minutes in the evening across the river to Trastavere - though we found that a bit too 'touristy' on a Saturday evening. We had better meals at Vecchio Romano (book in advance) and in a couple of tiny trattoria in side streets near the Pantheon. The hotel reception were very helpful in suggesting where to eat. We didn't book any tours in advance, but struck lucky at St Peter's, tagging on to a free tour in the morning by Jason of Roman Odyssey Tours - young American with a degree in Theology, a passion for art, and a brilliant storyteller; he was so good we all stuck with him for the 3 hour afternoon tour of the Sistine Chapel! Can't recommend him highly enough. Will definitely be returning to Rome - so much more to see - and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else but this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weezie57
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two weeks in Italy (4/9-22/05) We stayed at the Ponte Sisto for 5 nights. The rooms are small, (i have stayed in smaller ones though) but exceptionally well maintained and our bathroom was quite large. No real space to unpack so we lived out of our suitcases for 5 days. The front desk was extremely helpful and made restaurant reservations, confirmed our next hotel arrival, sent faxes for us... Breakfast was good and if you get the male waiter, he would make "pictures" in our cappuccino! Beautiful courtyard in the middle of the hotel - unfortunately it rained almost everyday we were in Rome so we didn't get to enjoy it.
